TC_Setup:
0. 1. Phone is powered on and camped on the network.
2. Pictures, videos and audio are stored on the phone and the external sdcard if external sdcard supported.
3. MMS and Email is setup on the phone.
TC_Steps:
0. Launch the Messaging application and compose an SMS and an MMS message with an attached image to a valid email address. Send the MMS and open the email account on a PC
1. From the PC reply to the email (If test carrier not support email account sent out MMS, please skip this step)
2. In Messaging app select multiple contacts at a time and compose an message then send the message
3. In Messaging app select multiple contacts and emails at a time and compose a SMS then send the message
TC_Expected_Results:
0. The messaging application should open and allow the user to compose SMS and MMS with an attached image. The email should be correctly received on the PC

The SMS is converted to MMS
1. The test phone should correctly receive the replay. The subject should show this is a reply (re: xxx)
2.  When the message is sent the phone will show as a SMS mass text (one message with multiple recipients)
3. The SMS is converted to MMS
TC_Labels: AOSP_Message BB8_not_applicable GMS_Message common_execute_local_network common_validation_reg difficulty_level_medium network_leverage non-VoLTE product_leverage

TC_Setup:
0. 1. 
Pictures & videos are stored on the phone and the external SDcard if the external sdcard is supported.
2. Group messaging is available in messaging settings.
3. In Messaging Settings, go to "Group Message" and select "Send an MMS reply to all recipients (group MMS)".
TC_Steps:
0. 1. Compose a message, put two valid phone numbers in the recipients. Add text then send the message.
2. Open the message sent out in step 1, reply the two recipients with an image attached then send the MMS.
3. Compose a message, put one valid number and one invalid number in the recipients. Send the message.
4. In Messaging Settings, go to "Group Message" and select "Send an SMS reply to all recipients and receive individual replies". Compose a message, put two valid phone numbers in the recipients. Add text then send the message.
5. Open the message sent out in step 4, reply the two recipients with an image attached then send the MMS.
6. Compose a message, paste two valid numbers and one invalid number (copy to valid numbers and an invalid separated by space e.g "312555888 312888555 0x0x0x0x0") in the recipients. Send the message.
7. Compose a message, paste two valid numbers (copy to valid numbers and an invalid separated by comma e.g "312555888, 312888555") in the recipients. Send the message.
8. Send and receive several messages in a row for the group, at least 6 MMS/SMS 
9. Receive several messages in a row for the group, at least 6 MMS/SMS
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 1. The message will be sent as a MMS. In message list it will displayed as one  conversation with two recipients, and  in the conversation there should be one thread. MMS should be received by the reference phones.
2. The MMS can be sent out successfully, and displayed in the conversation.
3. The message will be sent as a MMS. In message list it will displayed as one conversation with two recipients displayed, and in the conversation there should be one thread. MMS should be received by valid reference number and should be failed to the invaild reference number.
4. The message will be sent as two SMS. In message list it will displayed as one  conversation with two recipients, and  in the conversation there should be two seperated threads for two recipients. SMS should be received by the reference phones.
5. The MMS can be sent out successfully, and displayed in the conversation.
6. The message will be sent as two SMS. In message list it will displayed as one conversation with two recipients displayed, and in the conversation there should be two seperated threads for two recipients. SMS should be received by valid reference number and should be failed to the invaild reference number.
7. The message will be sent as a MMS. In message list it will displayed as one  conversation with two recipients, and  in the conversation there should be one thread. MMS should be received by the reference phones.
8. All messages shall be sent with no failures from DUT
9. All messages shall be received with no failures on DUT
TC_Labels: AOSP_Message BB8 CN_Partial_Support CN_Partial_Support_ATT EDA_updated common_execute_local_network common_validation_reg

TC_Setup:
0. The phone is powered on and camped on the network
1. Contacts are stored in the address both that have multiple phone numbers assigned to them
2. Group messaging is unchecked in messaging settings
TC_Steps:
2. Open the Messaging Application and compose a new message. In the recipients field enter a valid number that is not associated with any contact in the address book.
3. Tap on the badge
4. Enter another valid number, that has is not assigned to a contact, into the recipient field, after entering the number press the semicolon key (;)
5. Enter another valid number, that has is not assigned to a contact, into the recipient field, after entering the number press the comma key (,)
6. Enter another valid number, that has a contact assigned to it. (Such as contact A, and A should have multiple phone numbers assigned to it in the phone book.)
7. Select and change another listed number. Add some text to the message and select to send it.
TC_Expected_Results:
2. The user should be able to create a new message and manually add a number to the recipient list. Once the number is completed it should be shown as a badge.
3. When tapping on the badge there is just an option (x button) to remove the contact
4. When the semicolon key is pressed, a badge with the entered phone number should be shown.
5.  When the comma key is pressed, a badge with the entered phone number should be shown.
6. When the number entering, there will be a prompt of matching contact shown. Such as contact A will be displayed in the prompt list.
7. The recipient list should be updated with the edited recipients and when sent should be received by all selected phone numbers.
TC_Labels: AOSP_Message Android_O_updated BB8 CN_Partial_Support CN_Partial_Support_ATT common_execute_local_network common_validation_reg

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Phone is powered on and camped on the network.
2. Pictures & videos are stored on the phone and the external SDcard if the external sdcard is supported.
3. Group messaging is unchecked in messaging settings.
TC_Steps:
0. Launch the Messaging application and compose a new message, with a valid recipient, some text and an image file then click the back key
1. Open the draft message, check the contents of the MMS then replace the image with another image file then click the back key

2. Open the draft message, remove the attached image file and click the back key.

3. Open the draft message, then attach an image to the message. Edit the text, then send the message.

4. Long press on the sent MMS, then select to view the message details from the menu options

5. Receive an MMS with text and an attached image
6. After viewing the MMS message, long press and select to view the message details from the menu options

7. Long press on the received MMS and select forwarding from the menu options. Edit the text and remove the attached image. Long press the message to check details then send the edited message to a reference device
TC_Expected_Results:
0. When the image adding, SMS converts to MMS. When the back key is pressed, the phone should save the message as a draft and show a draft icon

1. Draft message opened and indicate it is MMS, all contents displayed same with before draft saved. Attach image changed and after the back keypress, updated message will save as draft
2. Draft message opened and indicate it is MMS, all contents displayed same with before draft saved. Attach image removed and after back keypress, updated message will save as draft
3. When the image is attached, the message should be converted to an MMS. The message should be sent and received correctly.

4. Message details dialog pops up with the details of the message, this should be consistent with the sent message
5. The MMS is correctly received and is able to view the contents

6. Message details dialog pops up with the details of the message, this should be consistent with the received message

7. The messaging application should bring up the option to edit the message and allow the user to edit the message by removing attachments and editing the text. The message details shall be displayed and the message should be sent and received on reference devices as an SMS
TC_Labels: AOSP_Message Android_O_updated BB8 CN_Partial_Support CN_Partial_Support_ATT common_execute_local_network common_refactored common_validation_reg

TC_Steps:
0. Compose a message to a saved contact by tapping the name and select in auto-complete list. Add the message and send as SMS/MMS  to support phone.
1. Compose message and type an email address until the address appears in the auto-complete list and then select it from the auto-complete list.

2. Add 3 more phone numbers to the recipient list. Send SMS/MMS message. 
3. Go to Message Settings and Disable Delivery reports, then compose a message and send it as SMS/MMS to a reference device.
4. Compose a message by typing the name of a contact, once the name appears in the auto-complete list, press the back key to delete.
5. Enter the maximum number of recipients (supported by the carrier) into the recipient field, then try to add more than that number.
6. Add some text  to the message and then send the message to the maximum number of recipients.
7. If applicable, repeat for step SIM 2.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Contacts matching the characters entered are displayed in the auto-complete. User is able to select a contact from the auto-complete and selecting it should fill in the rest of the recipients number. Once the message is received on the reference device the test phone should receive a delievery report.
1. Contacts matching the characters entered are displayed in the auto-complete. User is able to select a contact from the auto-complete list and selecting it should fill in the rest of the recipients email.
2. Auto complete should work for each recipient. The message should be correctly received on the support devices and for each message sent and received at to a phone number the DUT should receive a delivery report.
3. User is able to turn delivery reports OFF. The message should be correctly sent and received on the reference device and the DUT should not get a delivery report.
4. The phone should display contacts in the auto-complete that match the characters entered. After press back key, auto complete list is dismissed.
5. The phone should prompt the user that the maximum number of recipients has been reached and not allow more entries to be added.
6. All recipients should correctly receive the message.
7. Similar from above.
TC_Labels: AOSP_Message CN_Partial_Support CN_Partial_Support_ATT EDA_updated Plat_Reg common_execute_local_network common_validation_reg execute_local_network execute_local_network_brazil execute_local_network_china product_validation_reg

TC_Setup:
0. A Provisioning client to be configured. A Provisioning server connected to the Internet. The Client doesn''t have existing APN profile with the name of application being provisioned . Phone registered to the GSM or UMTS network.
Phone is in full_ui mode.		

XML provisioning document with right settings should be used for this test (test_017_DS.xml). The User Pin should be provided.		

Priority given to customer client provisioning server if available. Otherwise use the Motorola NowSMS server. Carrier requirements refers primarily to Verizon, Vodafone, and T-Mobile Europe for now.

You can download XML at: https://drive.google.com/a/motorola.com/folderview?id=0B-A2luimi8RUfjVpQjNsNGxqcmUzd2VYNjY3cU5ZWW5BbjduNHpWaWhYcEVlckVmQVdVelk&usp=sharing
TC_Steps:
0. From the Provisioning server, send the provisioning document to the phone.	
1. Select notification. Don''t accept the new APN Profile when prompted on the phone. Choose option Postpone.

2. Click on the notification and install updates.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Verify that new notification in the Notification Bar is displayed.
1. The message should be postponed. And notification in the Notification Bar is displayed.
2. Verify that the APN Profile is created correctly on the phone and all settings match the provisioning document.
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable Brazil_Support CN_BR_Support Latam_Reg OMACP common_validation_reg difficulty_level_medium network_dependent

TC_Setup:
0. A Provisioning client to be configured. A Provisioning server connected to the Internet. The Client doesn't have existing APN profile with the name  of application being provisioned . Phone registered to the GSM or UMTS network. Phone is in full_ui mode. APN Profile with application name from provisioning document already exists on the phone.

XML provisioning document with right settings should be used for this test (test_019_DF.xml). The User Pin should be provided.

Priority given to customer client provisioning server if available. Otherwise use the Motorola NowSMS server.  Carrier requirements refers primarily to Verizon, Vodafone, and T-Mobile Europe for now.

You can download XML at: https://drive.google.com/a/motorola.com/folderview?id=0B-A2luimi8RUfjVpQjNsNGxqcmUzd2VYNjY3cU5ZWW5BbjduNHpWaWhYcEVlckVmQVdVelk&usp=sharing
TC_Steps:
0. From the Provisioning server, send the provisioning document to the phone.	.

1. Select notification. Accept the new APN Profile when prompted on the phone, enter the authentication pin and choose option Update APN profile.	
2. Verify the APN Profile is present on the phone.	
3. From the Provisioning server, send the provisioning document to the phone.	

4. Select notification. Accept the new APN Profile when prompted on the phone, enter the authentication pin and select New when prompted on the phone New or Overwrite, enter new name for the APN profile.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Verify that new notification in the Notification Bar is displayed
1. Verify that the phone prompts for the end user to accept or ignore the new APN profile.

2. Verify that the APN Profile is created correctly on the phone and all settings match the provisioning document.

3. Verify that new notification in the Notification Bar is displayed.
4. Verify that the APN Profile is created correctly on the phone and all settings match the provisioning document.

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Browser is set up correctly. 
3. Email account is set up. 
2. PUT is bonded via Bluetooth with TSP. 
4. There is at least one audio file stored in PUT. 
5. Wired headset is needed.  
6. PUT is in Idle. 

1. (Mandatory) When testing think like a consumer and report defects on poor experiences and annoyances. 2. Tester should attempt all the steps. 3. Testers need to identify step that failed when opening defect. Like if step 3 failed and they open a Bug they should put a comment on TC "Step 3: CR XXXX".  4. SI Push message: WAP Push Service Indication message.  5. If PUT does not support Unified Inbox, use Message Inbox instead.  6. Set Screen Timeout by Settings > Sound & Display. 

10. Issues to be aware of:
Future use: List any specific issues with scenarios from lessons learned or any past defects that should be verified when running this test case.

1. (Insert from EDA or Call Center data) List the expected result.

2. Verify that PUT works as expected, there are no panics, freezes, black/white screens and any phone behavior that leads the test engineer to believe there's a product defect.

Cleanup: Delete the received WAP Push SI messages.
TC_Steps:
0. Send a SI Push message with Signal Action "None" to PUT.  Receive a SMS. Go to message inbox.  Go back to main menu.
1. Send a SI Push message with Signal Action "Low" to PUT. Go to unified inbox.  Send a SI Push message with Signal Action "Medium" to PUT. Read the SI message.  Receive an email. Go to Idle. 

2. Launch Browser. Send a SI Push message with Signal Action "High" to PUT.  Read the SI message. Rotate the phone, then go to the URL of the SI message.  Go back to Idle. 

3. Receive Bluetooth file transfer. Accept and save the file.  Send a SI Push message with Signal Action "Medium" to PUT. Read the SI message.  Go back to Idle. 

4. Send a SI Push message with Signal Action "Medium" to PUT.  Read and go to the URL of the SI message.  When PUT is in Browser, send a SI Push message with Signal Action "None" to PUT.  Go back to Idle. 

5. Send a SI Push message with Signal Action "High" to PUT.  Read and go to the URL of the SI message.  When PUT is in Browser, send a SI Push message with Signal Action "Low" to PUT.  Go back to Idle. 

6. Play an audio file, wait for screen time out.  Send a SI Push message with Signal Action "Medium" to PUT.  Read the SI message.  Stop the audio playback and back to Idle. 

7. 
Plug in wired headset and make a call.
Send a SI Push message with Signal Action "High" to PUT.
End the call and plug out wired headset. 
8. Set up an alarm clock.
When the alarm clock expires and alarm alert is playing, send a SI Push message with Signal Action "High" to PUT.
Dismiss the alarm. 
9.  Reserved for Tester if time permits to explore feature and PUT from consumer Use Case perspective that may not be listed in this Charter. The Tester may add more common use cases to Test Central Comments Section. Use "Step 10" in header of Comment.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "None" is silently discarded.  Verify that the SMS is received and shown in message inbox.  Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "None" is not received nor shown in message inbox. 


1. Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "Low" is silently placed into inbox without audio alert.  Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "Medium" is received with audio alert.  Verify that the SI Push messages are shown with distinctive icons or other indicators in notification bar and unified inbox.  Verify that the email is received. 
2. Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "High" is received with audio alert and distinctive icons or other indicators.  Verify that the web page is displayed when go to the URL of the SI message.  Verify that changing the screen orientation doest not affect the SI message. 

3. Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "Medium" is received with audio alert and distinctive icons or other indicators.  Verify that the file transfer is completed. 

4. Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "Medium" is received with audio alert and distinctive icons or other indicators.
Verify that the web page is displayed when go to the URL of the SI message.
Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "None" is silently discarded. 
5. Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "High" is received with audio alert and distinctive icons or other indicators.  Verify that the web page is displayed when go to the URL of the SI message.  Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "Low" is silently stored in inbox. 

6. Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "Medium" is received with audio alert and distinctive icons or other indicators.  Verify that the SI message is read. 

7. Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "High" is received with no audio alert. Verify that the call and plugging in/out wired headset does not affect the SI message. 
8. Verify that the SI Push message with Signal Action "High" is received with audio alert and distinctive icons or other indicators. 
9. Verify that PUT remains stable, works as expected, there are no panics, freezes, black/white screens and any phone behavior that leads the test engineer to believe there's a product defect. Requirement link is located at "Procedure section within tc".
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable CN_BR_Support EDA_updated FEATURE-3650 Latam_Reg OMACP common_validation_reg difficulty_level_high execute_local_network network_dependent network_leverage

TC_Setup:
0. Test Content Location: XML provisioning document with right settings should be present on server (test_201.xml) Physical Proxy already defined.
1. Initial Conditions:
a) A Client Provisioning client to be configured.
b) A Client Provisioning server connected to the Internet.
c) The Client doesn't have existing bootstrap context Phone registered to the GSM or UMTS network.
2. https://drive.google.com/a/motorola.com/folderview?id=0B-A2luimi8RUfjVpQjNsNGxqcmUzd2VYNjY3cU5ZWW5BbjduNHpWaWhYcEVlckVmQVdVelk&usp=sharing
5. Note: Ignore step 4 if the test is not being running in Europe.
TC_Steps:
2. 1) From the Client Provisioning server, send the provisioning document to the phone. 
3. 2) Accept the APN Profile when prompted on the phone and enter the authentication PIN if required.
4. 3) Verify the APN Profiles list on the phone.
5. 4) Browse the operator web page using the new APN Profiles.
TC_Expected_Results:
2. 1) Verify that the phone displays a confirm update dialog.
3. 2) Verify that the phone prompts for the end user to accept or ignore the new APN profiles.
4. 3) Verify that the APN Profile is saved and used correctly on the phone with the first Physical Proxy settings. The second Physical Proxy is ignored.
5. 4) Phone can browse web pages.
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable CN_BR_Support Latam_Reg OMACP common_validation_reg difficulty_level_medium network_dependent

TC_Setup:
0. Test Content Location: XML provisioning document with right settings should be present on server (test_203.xml).
1. Initial Condition:
a) A Client Provisioning client to be configured.
b) A Client Provisioning server connected to the Internet.
c) The Client doesn't have existing bootstrap context Phone registered to the GSM or UMTS network.
2. https://drive.google.com/a/motorola.com/folderview?id=0B-A2luimi8RUfjVpQjNsNGxqcmUzd2VYNjY3cU5ZWW5BbjduNHpWaWhYcEVlckVmQVdVelk&usp=sharing
5. Note: Ignore step 4 if the test is not being running in Europe.
TC_Steps:
2. 1) Open the browser and launch a web page. From the Client Provisioning server, send the provisioning document to the phone.
3. 2) Accept the new Connectivity Profile if prompted on the phone.
4. 3) Verify the connectivity Profile list on the phone.
5. 4) Continue browsing the operator web page.
TC_Expected_Results:
2. 1) Verify that the phone is able to browse.
3. 2) There are 2 different scenarios provisioning silent (minimum UI and network PIN) and not silent (all others). If it is not silent - only new notification will appear in the notification bar, no interruption and no user screens. If silent mode, provisioning runs in the background and may be interrupted, but it should be re-established automatically.
4. 3) Verify that the APN Profile is created correctly on the phone and all settings match the provisioning document.
5. 4) Verify that the web broswing session is re-established.
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable CN_BR_Support Latam_Reg OMACP common_validation_reg difficulty_level_medium network_dependent no_efficiency

6. After pairing and connecting BT accessory, pop-up shall remain on screen

8. Check if pop-up for data roaming will not be shown when data roaming is enabled

TC_Setup:
0. Phone is powered on and camped on the home network.
In Call Settings Assisted Dialing is set to enabled and Reference Country is set to USA. (VZW only products)
In Call Settings AutoRetry is set to enabled.

Make sure VoLTE is NOT enabled
TC_Steps:
0. 1.If assisted dialling is supported dial an international number using just the country code and the telephone number. (eg 44 for the UK and telephone number 871 789 3642)
2.If assisted dialing is supported, disable it in call settings and redial the number used in step 1.
3.Is AutoRedial / AutoRetry is supported make sure it is supported in call settings.
4.Make a call to a reference device. Do not answer the call on the reference device. As the call is being attempted move the test phone into an area of no coverage (eg. a shielded RF box).
5.Move the phone back into an area of network coverage.
6.Accept the call on the reference device. Verify the call connected correctly then end the call.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 1.The calling application should automatically add the prefix to dial an international call. In this case 011 44 8717893642. The number in the recent call list should also be 011 44 8717893642
2.The calling application should dial the number as entered and not modify it. 448717893641 should be shown in the recent call list.
3.The user should be able to enable auto redial / auto retry correctly.
4.The call should fail when the phone is moved into an area of no coverage.
5.The phone should autodial the call that failed. The reference phone should alert to the incoming call.
6.The call should connect and audio should be clear in both directions.
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable EDA_updated common_validation_reg execute_femtocell_vzw network_dependent non-VoLTE

TC_Setup:
0. Notes :

- Check Confluence to learn how to use the SMS CIn tool :https://confluence.mot.com/display/PLAT/SMS_CIn+tool+-+Sending+provisioning+messages

1. PUT is in idle screen.
2. WAP Push message service is set to "Receive All".
Set date of PUT to 2009/03/10.
Need 4 SI messages as below when testing:
SI message A: "SI ID" = "120", "SI created" = "2009/03/09 16:50", "SI Expires" = "2009/03/12 16:50"
SI message B: "SI ID" = "120", "SI created" = "2009/03/09 17:00", "SI Expires" = "2009/03/12 17:00"
SI message C: "SI ID" = "120", "SI created" = "2009/03/09 19:10", "SI Expires" = "2009/03/12 19:10"

Please make sure WAP URL field is filled before send the SI Message. 
If the tester are using NOW SMS, please observe the tool time zone is Coordinated universal time ( UTC 0 ).
TC_Steps: 0. Send an expired SI message. Send SI message B, A, C one by one to PUT. When receiving message C receive and ignore an incoming call.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Verify that the expired SI message is discarded.
Verify that message B can be received and save into Inbox successfully. Message A is discarded. After receiving message C, message B is replaced by message C into Inbox.
Verify that incoming call can be received and ignored normally and it doesn''t cause any unexpected behavior.

Verify that PUT works as expected, there are no panics, freezes, black/white screens and any phone behavior that leads the test engineer to believe theres a product defect.
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable CN_BR_Support FEATURE-3650 Latam_Reg OMACP common_validation_reg difficulty_level_medium execute_local_network network_dependent

1. There is a WAP Push SI message A with ID "120" in inbox.
2. PUT is in Main Menu. If tester are using NowSMS, please make sure SI Created and SI Expires fields are filled before send a SI message with action "delete" and SI created must be a date after the message A.
3. WAP Push message service is set to "Receive All".
Set an alarm clock which will expire soon.

CR IKSWM-8248 to confirm SI message with action "delete " behavior.

Please make sure WAP URL field is filled before send the SI Message. 
If the tester are using NOW SMS, please observe the tool time zone is Coordinated universal time ( UTC 0 ).
TC_Steps:
0. Send a SI message B with ID = "120" and action = "delete". 
1. Then go to inbox to check message A.
2. Send a SI message C with action "signal-none".
3. Receive a normal SI message D only with some text and WAP URL and read it.
4. Wait till event alarm pops up, snooze it. Go to Inbox to check message D.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Verify that message B is discarded.
1. Verify that message A disappeared from inbox.
2. Verify that message C is discarded.
3. Verify that message D can be received and read successfully.
4. Verify that the alarm is snoozed and PUT back to message D read screen.
Verify that message D is saved into Inbox.

Verify that PUT works as expected, there are no panics, freezes, black/white screens and any phone behavior that leads the test engineer to believe theres a product defect.

4.Terminate the call.
5.Place a call from B to A.

   Make a request for VCO from B side > Accept VCO request and turn on speaker from A side > Speak through device B microphone.
7. Go to Dialer > Settings and try to change TTY  Mode while in call
8.Terminate the call.
TC_Expected_Results:

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Add IMAP and POP email account on test device (use Gmail App)
2. Set sync frequency to 15 minutes

3. Configure Doze Mode
Turn On: If a user leaves a device unplugged and stationary for a period of time (about 5~10 min), with the screen off, the device enters Doze mode. 

Turn Off: As soon as the user wakes the device by moving it, turning on the screen, or connecting a charger, the system exits Doze and all apps return to normal activity.

You can also use the commands:

Force the system into idle mode by running the following command:
adb shell dumpsys deviceidle force-idle

When ready, exit idle mode by running the following command:
adb shell dumpsys deviceidle unforce
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 1. New email should be sent to IMAP and POP mail account;

2. After wait for more than the time of sync frequency, It should not have any email notification on test device;

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Setup Gmail account on test device;
2. Please check sync Gmail is checked;

3. Configure Doze Mode: 
Turn On: If a user leaves a device unplugged and stationary for a period of time (about 5~10 min), with the screen off, the device enters Doze mode. 

Turn Off: As soon as the user wakes the device by moving it, turning on the screen, or connecting a charger, the system exits Doze and all apps return to normal activity.

You can also use the commands:

Force the system into idle mode by running the following command:
  adb shell dumpsys deviceidle force-idle

When ready, exit idle mode by running the following command:
  adb shell dumpsys deviceidle unforce
TC_Steps:
0. 1. Put device in Doze;

2. Send one email to the Gmail account.

3. Exit doze mode.

4. On PC, login to the Gmail account, create a new calendar event which will be triggered in 2 minutes.

5. Wait for more than 2 minutes, Check calendar notification on test device.

6. Put device in Doze Mode again.

7. On PC, create a new calendar event which will be triggered in 2 minutes.

8. Wait for more than 2 minutes, check calendar notification.

9. Exit Doze Mode.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 1. The test device should be in Doze mode.

2. Test device should not receive the new email. User will not get new email notification.

3. The email should be received.

4. The new event should be added on server.

5. Should be a calendar notification on test device.

6. The test device should be in Doze mode.

7. The event should be added on server.

8. There is no new calendar notification because the event should bot be synced to test device while in Doze Mode.

9. The calendar notification should comes.
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable GMS_Reg binary_leverage common_validation_reg low_pri_auto no_efficiency non_network_dependent

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Setup a Google Account on the test device
- Finish initial setup for Play Store. Ensure there are some apps which need updating

2. Verify Battery Optimization status for Google Play Store
and check if Play store is whitelisted or not

3. Doze mode:
Turn On: If a user leaves a device unplugged and stationary for a period of time (about 5~10 min), with the screen off, the device enters Doze mode. 

Turn Off: As soon as the user wakes the device by moving it, turning on the screen, or connecting a charger, the system exits Doze and all apps return to normal activity.

You can also use the commands:

Force the system into idle mode by running the following command:
  adb shell dumpsys deviceidle force-idle

When ready, exit idle mode by running the following command:
  adb shell dumpsys deviceidle unforce
TC_Steps:
0. 1. Refer to these commands to put device in doze mode:
1.1 Simulate cable disconnected
  $ adb shell dumpsys battery unplug
1.2 Change device state in doze workflow:
  $ adb shell dumpsys deviceidle step [light|deep]
1.3 Turn display off

2. Enter Doze mode;

3. Exit doze mode by turning on display or reconnecting with command:
$ adb shell dumpsys battery reset
TC_Labels: BB8 EDA_updated GMS_Reg binary_leverage common_validation_reg no_efficiency non_network_dependent

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Device is normal sound mode. "Do not disturb" is off

Note: 
feature "Do not disturb" introduced from Android M.
TC_Steps:
0. For P builds: go to "Do Not Disturb" settings -> "Sound & vibration" and enable only Alarms option. Then go to "Turn on automatically" -> "Add rule" -> "Time" and name it as "Test 1".

For Android 10: go to "Do Not Disturb" settings -> "Schedules" -> "Add more" -> "Time" and name it as "Test 1". On "Test 1" settings go to "Do Not Disturb behavior" -> "Create custom settings" and leave only "Allow alarms" enabled.
1. Wait for until start time of "Test 1" comes
2. Receive incoming call, messaging, alarm, calendar event, etc. 
3. Wait for until end time of rule "Test 1" expires
4. For P builds: go to "Do Not Disturb" settings -> "Sound & vibration" and leave all options disabled. Then go to "Turn on automatically" -> "Add rule" -> "Time" and name it as "Test 2".

For Android 10: go to "Do Not Disturb" settings -> "Schedules" -> "Add more" -> "Time" and name it as "Test 2". On "Test 2" settings go to "Do Not Disturb behavior" -> "Create custom settings" and leave all the options disabled.
5. Wait for until start time of rule "Test 2" comes
6. Receive incoming call, messaging, alarm, calendar event, etc. 
7. Wait for until end time of rule "Test 2" expires
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Rule "Test 1" is on
1. Do Not Disturb is turned on
2. Alarm with ring played. 
No sound or vibrate when other types of event received.
3. Do Not Disturb is turned off
4. Rule "Test 2" is on
5. Do Not Disturb is turned on
6. No sound or vibrate when each type of event received.
7. Do Not Disturb is turned off
TC_Labels: Android_M Android_O_updated Android_Q_updated BB8_not_applicable Core_Reg binary_leverage common_line common_validation_reg difficulty_level_high dnd network_leverage no_efficiency10 product_leverage

TC_Setup:

1. Add valid Google account on the device
TC_Steps:
1. Go to "Do not disturb" settings

2. Tap on Schedules
3. Add a new event rule "EventTest" with the below settings:
    
-- During events for: "Any calendar"
-- Where reply is: "Yes"
-- Do Not Disturb behavior: Set a custom setting with Alarms only enabled
4. Received a calendar event invitation from others, but do NOT reply to it
5. Wait until the event start time comes

6. Before the event expires, open the calendar event and reply with "No"

7. Before the event expires, change the reply to "Maybe"

8. Before the event expires, change the reply to "Yes"

9. Delete the rule "EventTest"
TC_Expected_Results:
3. New added rule "EventTest" is on
4. Get calendar event reminder 
5. The device is still in normal mode. "Alarm only" should NOT be triggered 

6. The device is still in normal mode. "Alarm only" should NOT be triggered 

7. The device is still in normal mode. "Alarm only" should NOT be triggered 

8. "Alarm only" should be triggered

9. Rule "EventTest" is deleted and the device exit "Alarm only" mode

TC_Steps:

6. Verify contact info is displayed

TC_Steps:
0. Turn on device
Skip step up 
Open Wi-Fi Settings 
Try to remove or edit Preloaded Verizon Wifi Offloading SSID 

1. Go to the Settings Menu and turn on and off Wi-Fi a number of times, then connect to a WiFi access point and turn WiFi on and off a number of times.
2. Go to the WiFi menu in the Settings Menu and select to scan for available access points.
3. Select to disconnect/forget the currently connected WiFi access point. In the WiFi Settings menu enable Notify Me (When launching apps, notify when WiFi is available). Go to an area where there are WiFi access points in range and open the browser.
4. Exit the browser, connect the phone to a WiFi access point then reopen the browser. Exit the browser and disconnect/forget the WiFi access point, keep the Notify Me option enabled, disable WiFi then reopen the browser.
5. Launch Mobile Hotspot application from the Application Menu. Enable and disable Mobile Hotspot rapidly a couple of times. Enable Mobile Hotspot and open Mobile Hotspot Settings, and configure the phone to be a Mobile Hotspot. Set a password that is less than 8 characters, try to save, then set a password that is more than 8 characters.
6. Using a PC search for available WiFi Hotspots. Try to connect to the phone using an incorrect password, then select the correct password.
7. On the test phone, in Mobile Hotspot settings, select Manage devices and set the maximum devices to 2. Connect a second reference device to the test phone, then try to connect a third device.
8. Disconnect the devices from the test phone. Disable Mobile Hotspot and close the Mobile Hotspot application.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Device turned on
Skipped
Wi-Fi settings opened
Preloaded Verizon WiFi Offloading SSID should not be removable or editable.
1. WiFi should be turned on and off smoothly and correctly when no WiFi access points are connected to. The user should be able to connect to a WiFi access point and turn WiFi on and off smothly and correctly. Each time WiFi is turned on the phone should connect automatically to the access point it was originally connected to.
2. The phone should refresh the list of available WiFi access points and show all available WiFi access points within range. The list should be consistant with known WiFi access points within range.
3. The phone should allow the user to disconnect/forget the currently connected WiFi access point correctly and not automatically connect to it. The phone should correctly enable Notify Me option and when the browser is open prompt the user that WiFi access points are available.
4. The user should be allowed to modify the WiFi Notify Me setting correctly, and both times when the browser is opened the phone should not get a prompt for WiFi availability.
5. The phone should launch the Mobile Hotspot application correctly and enabl/disable the feature each time enable/disable is selected. The phone should allow the user to configure the phone as a Mobile Hotspot, with each option being editable by the user. The phone should not allow a password less than 8 characters and not give the option to save the configuration if a password less than 8 characters is selected.
6. When searching for available WiFi Hotspots on the PC the test phone should be visiable. The PC should only be able to connect to the test phone when the correct password is entered.
7. The phone should allow the user to set the maximum number of connected devices to 2, when this change is made the test phone should prompt the user to restart the Mobile Hotspot appllication. The phone should allow two devices to connect to the test phone, and reject a thrid device from connecting.
8. The reference phones should disconnect from the test phone without any adverse effects. The phone should disable Mobile Hotspot and close the Mobile Hotspot application correctly.
TC_Labels: Android_O_updated BB8_not_applicable FEATURE-5019 FEATURE-5219 FEATURE-6236 Plat_Reg VZW_Reg common_validation_reg execute_femtocell_vzw execute_local_network product_validation_reg

TC_Setup:
0. On Dialer Settins, turned on WiFi Calling
Have four support devices with VoLTE SIM Cards (A, B, C e D)
TC_Steps:
0. MO/MT Call to Support A over WiFI

1. Accept the call on Support A and verify the audio in both directions 

2. Make the second call to Support B. Accept the call on Support B and then merge the calls on DUT

3. Maintain the call for 2 minutes, and verify that audio and hold fuctions

4. Make a Call using DUT to Support C. Connect the call and verify audio.

5. Using DUT, Merge the Conference call with Voice calls. 

6. Maintain the call for 2 minutes, and verify that audio can be heard in all direction.

7. Using the DUT End the all calls on all phones
TC_Expected_Results:
0. DUT should show that it is calling Support A. Support A should alert to the incoming call

1. Both phone should show that the call has successfully connected and there should be clear audio in both directions. 

2. DUT should notify the user that it is dialing Support B while connected to Support A. Once connected DUT should be able to merge the call and 3-way/conference calling should be established. 

3. The phone should be able to maintain a 3-way/conference call for the duration of the call with clear audio in all directions, while  Conference call is on hold DUT shall not be able to talk to or hear Support A or Support B. Support A and Support B should be able to hear and talk to each other.

4. The conference call should remain on hold and Call with Support C should be initiated

6. The phone should be able to maintain a 4-way/conference call for the duration of the call with clear audio in all directions.

7. All calls should successfully be terminated
TC_Labels: ATT_Reg Cricket_Reg FEATURE-5013 Plat_Reg common_validation_reg execute_femtocell_att execute_live_cricket execute_local_roaming_att_brazil product_validation_reg

adb shell dumpsys backup | find "Current:"
TC_Steps:
0. Open the application to be tested, customize its settings and generate different data

Mark the changes somewhere for later comparison
1. Force application data backup with following commands:
adb shell bmgr run
adb shell bmgr fullbackup [app_package]
2. Clear app data:

Andoid N go to: Settings -> Apps -> Select app under test -> Storage -> CLEAR DATA 
Android O go to: Settings -> Apps & notifications -> App info -> Select app under test -> Storage -> CLEAR DATA 

or Uninstall and reinstall the app (in this case, restore is automatically called)
3. Force application data restore with the command: 
adb shell bmgr restore [token] [app_package]

Then compare if app settings were restored
TC_Expected_Results:
0. The app configuration should be changed
1. App data is backed up in the account's storage
2. App data should be reseted
3. App data settings should be restored successfully

TC_Setup:
0. - DUT is registered on 5G Network
- There is a WiFi AP remembered on device
- WiFi is off
TC_Steps:
0. Launch browser and start to download a big file (size > 10Gb)

1. While file is being downloaded, Move away from 5G to 4G only network
10. While file is being uploaded, turn WiFi on in order to switch to Wifi data

11. Turn WiFi off
12. Turn WiFi on again
13. Drop Wifi by turning off AP or router
14. Repeat the (10-14) steps above by uploading several files (total > 10Gb)
2. While file is being downloaded, Turn on Wifi and connect to a Wifi AP.

3. Move away from 4G to 5G only network
4. Turn WiFi off
5. Turn WiFi on again
6. Drop Wifi by turning off AP or router
7. Repeat steps above downloading several files at same time
8. Go to Mobile Data > Data Usage
9. Start to upload a big file (size > 10Gb)
TC_Expected_Results:
1. DUT data shall switch to 4G network without Modem Silent Panics or any other related Bug2go issue. 
Download shall keep ongoing without issues
10. While file is being uploaded, turn WiFi on in order to switch to Wifi data

11. WiFi shall switch back to 5G data. Upload shall keep ongoing without issues
12. 5G data shall switch to WiFi network. Upload shall keep ongoing without issues
13. WiFi shall switch to 5G data. Upload shall keep ongoing without issues
14. Upload shall occur without issues. no currupted files or breakages of uploads shall be noticed
2. DUT data shall switch to WiFi network without Modem Silent Panics or any other related Bug2go issue. 
Download shall keep ongoing without issues
3. DUT data shall switch to 5G network without Modem Silent Panics or any other related Bug2go issue. 
Download shall keep ongoing without issues
4. WiFi shall switch back to 5G data. Download shall keep ongoing without issues
5. 5G Data shall switch to WiFi network. Download shall keep ongoing without issues
6. WiFi shall switch to 5G data. Download shall keep ongoing without issues
7. Downloads shall finishes while switching between technologies with no corrupted files
8. Verify that downloaded file data is distributed on Wifi Data usage and Mobile data usage
TC_Labels: 5G_NR 5G_Reg APAC_5G_Reg ATT_5G_Reg PRC_5G_Reg PRC_PRC PRC_Pickup Plat_Reg Retus_5G_Reg TMO_5G_Reg VZW_5G_Reg common_validation_reg execute_davros_china execute_live_att feature_5G product_validation_reg

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Go to Settings > Accessibility and check that  RTT (Real Time Text) Call setting is Off by default 
2. WFC is enabled and supported by carrier
TC_Steps:
0. Initiate a WFC from DUT1 to support device, while call is ongoing go to accessibility settings and check RTT setting
1. Go to Accessibility settings and enable the RTT
2. Initiate a RRT Call betwen DUT and support device (01) then start chating 
3. From DUT RTT call try to add other support device (02)
4. From DUT, try to merge calls
TC_Expected_Results:
0. DUT should keeps RTT off
1. RTT settings should be ON
2. User should be able to send and receive the RTT messages
3. The option on the Call screen to add a call while on an existing call shall be enabled. However, the two calls shall not be able to be merged 
4. The two calls shall not be able to be merged
TC_Labels: BB8 FEATURE-6218 Plat_Reg VZW_Reg common_execute_live_network common_validation_reg execute_davros execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india execute_femtocell_vzw low_pri_auto product_validation_reg

TC_Setup:
0. Go to Settings > Accessibility and check that  RTT (Real Time Text) Call setting is Off by default 
2. If DUT supports Video Call, otherwise skip this step
TC_Steps:
0. Initiate a VoLTE call from DUT1 to support device, while call is ongoing go to accessibility settings and check RTT setting
1. Go to Accessibility settings and enable the RTT
2. Try to make some Video Call to DUT

3. Initiate a RRT Call betwen DUT and support device (01) then start chating 
4. From DUT RTT call try to add other support device (02)
5. From DUT, try to merge calls
TC_Expected_Results:
0. DUT should keeps RTT off
1. RTT settings should be ON
2. User should not be able to initiate the Video Call to DUT on support device
3. User should be able to send and receive the RTT messages
4. Support device can be added susccesfulyl. The option on the Call screen to add a call while on an existing call shall be enabled.
5. The two calls shall not be able to be merged
TC_Labels: BB8 FEATURE-6218 Plat_Reg VZW_Reg common_execute_live_network common_refactored common_validation_reg execute_davros execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india execute_femtocell_vzw low_pri_auto product_validation_reg

TC_Setup:
0. Device with child is setup with Family link app installed

NOTE: 
Time limits will apply to apps installed on all of your child's devices. 
System apps aren't supported by the app limit functionality. Limits can only be set for Android N+ devices.
TC_Steps:
0. In the Parent device, Launch 'Family Link' app. 
Tap on the child device being supervised.

1. Scroll down until ' Screen time' and tap on 'Set up'.

2. Set 'daily limit' to 15 minutes and 'bedtime' 20 minutes ahead of current time, for example.

3. Wait until child's usage reach Daily limit.

4. On Parent's device, unlock the child's device.

5. Wait until time reaches bedtime set on step 3.
NOTE: Daily Limit options:
- No limit for Sun and Sat
- Mon - Fri with +- 15 mins which can also be applied to - All days/School (Mon - Sat)
Bedtime options:
- Sun - Sat lock and unlock time can be set with 'Also apply to' - All nights/School (Sun - Fri)
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Child device name is displayed.
Several options which are applicable for the Child are displayed ex: list of devices, settings, location, screen time, etc
1. navigates to a screen where we can set 'Daily limit' and 'Bedtime'
2. 'Daily limit' and 'bedtime' are set.
3. Child device will get a notification on Moto display when the
Child device is about to be locked
NOTE: Child device will also get a notification when Screen time is set for the first time (Android devices only)
5. Child device will get a notification on Moto display when the
Child device is about to be locked
NOTE: Child device will also get a notification when Screen time is set for the first time (Android devices only)
TC_Labels: Android_Q Exp_Reg binary_leverage common_validation_reg difficulty_level_medium non_network_dependent

TC_Setup:
0. Gmail Account is configured. 
PIN/Pattern/Password lock is set
Navigate to Settings -> Digital Wellbeing & parental controls
Parental Controls are set i.e Parent (DUT1) and Child (DUT2)

NOTE: Family link app is to be downloaded from Play-store as part of the Parent and Child setup.
Parent - Family link for Parents
Child - Family link for children & teens
TC_Steps:
0. In the device set as Parent, Navigate to Settings -> System -> Advanced -> Multi users -> Add users/Guest 
1. In the device set as Parent (DUT1), Switch to Guest user.

Configure the same Google account which was in owner
2. Launch 'Family Link' app.Tap on the child device being supervised. 
1) Check for list of device which can be supervised
2) On the "Location" card, tap Set Up. Turn on the settings required to see your child's location. Tap Turn on.
3) Activity card - Manage apps -> Check for
 i) Activity tab. 
ii) in the limit tab, Set limit to eg: 2hr 30 mins or Block apps or check for installed apps..
4) Check the lock/unlock card.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Multi-users are added.
1. Device is in Guest user and the same gmail is configured successfully.
2. 1) list of devices which can be supervised is displayed.
2) Child location is displayed in the Parent device
NOTE: It might take up to 30 minutes to see your child's device location.
3) 
i)Activity tab displays the child's activity for - Today, Yesterday, Last 7 days, Last 30 days. 
ii) Limit tab - time limit can be set for each app and also can block each app. Newly installed apps are displayed in the apps list.
4) If the child is locked, it will display as 'Unlocked' with LOCK option available (so that the parent can lock the device).
TC_Labels: Android_Q GMS_Reg binary_leverage common_validation_reg difficulty_level_medium non_network_dependent

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Have at least 1 SIM card with Roaming service

2. Choose 2 SIM cards from different carriers that support NITZ in 4G

3. Brazilian carriers that get NITZ information when camping on 4G:
Claro, Tim
TC_Steps:
0. In roaming environment: insert the Roaming SIM card and wait for it to camp and change the time zone
1. Once the time zone is changed, remove roaming SIM and insert the 2 SIM cards chosen before
2. Set slot 1 as DDS and change preferred network type to 4G for both slots
3. Turn on APM, leave roaming state and go to an area where there is network signal for both carriers
4. Turn off APM, wait for DUT to camp and check if time zone zone was correctly changed
5. Repeat above steps but with slot 2 set as DDS in step 3
TC_Expected_Results:
0. DUT can camp and time zone is changed correctly according to the network provided in roaming environment
2. SIM 1 is set as DDS and preferred network type is changed to 4G for both slots
4. Time zone is changed correctly
5. Same as above
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable Latam_Reg Plat_Reg common_validation_reg product_validation_reg psim_psim

Peek display (AOD) is ON
TC_Steps:
0. On clock Turn Pop on screen for Alarm,Timer and Stopwatch OFF 

1. Set an alarm, lock the device and wait the alarm timeout
2. When alarm time is complete, receive a MT call. 
3. Dismiss alarm while call is been received
4. Repeat steps 2 to 4 using Timer 
5. Start a stopwatch, lock the screen and check AOD
TC_Expected_Results:
1. When the alarm time is complete, alarm notification is displayed on AOD

2. Alarm notification is received successfully on lockscreen. Call  notification can be seen while alarm is ringing

3. Call notification is still seen on screen lock, and it's possible to answer and ignore
5. Stopwatch notification can be seen on AOD, and it's possible to pause, start and restore.
TC_Labels: BB8 GMS_Reg common_execute_local_network common_validation_reg difficulty_level_high network_dependent network_leverage

4. Rotate your finger at different angles to unlock. Such as 90 degrees, 180 degrees, 270 degrees (Do not wake up AOD)
5. Repeat steps 2-5 with the finger of the other hand (Do not wake up AOD)
6. Use different fingers to unlock 20 times (Do not wake up AOD)
7. Remove all fingerprints and unlock (Do not wake up AOD)
TC_Expected_Results:
0. The lock icon is displayed on the AOD interface, but the fingerprint icon is not displayed. Cannot unlock phone with fingerprint




1. Display the fingerprint icon on the AOD interface, you can use the fingerprint to unlock the phone
2. The screen is off
3. The phone can be unlocked under a black screen and enter the interface before the lock screen.
Note: Once user enrolls at least one fingerprint this feature should be automatically enabled
4. can be unlocked correctly when the screen is off
5. Same result
6. Unlock phone successfully without lifting the finger and no crash, freezing screen
7. Can not unlock the phone,need enter password

TC_Setup:
0. - DUT and Support device are RCS Capable and connected on LTE or WiFi network
- Have few image/audio/video files
- Chat features Status "Connected" on Messages settings
- "Messages" and "Carrier Services" apps updated
- Insert on DUT a SIM Card on Slot 1

Note : According to the Google guide, RCS on multi-SIMs devices should work only for one SIM at the time. Refer to IKSWQ-82591
TC_Steps:
0. Initiate a group chat and start conversation. Check for "is typing" message when other person is typing.  

1. Delete messages

2. Enable Delivery and read reports. Send some chat messages

3. Turn off WiFi, turn on Network data and disable "Auto-download files you receive over mobile data" and receive a video/image/audio file
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Group conversation is successful. "...is typing" is displayed while the other person is typing

1. Selected messages are deleted

2. Delivered and Read indications are displayed as text in format "time sent/received - state"

3. Files are not auto-downloaded.
TC_Labels: BB8 Latam_Reg MTK_Reg Plat_Reg common_validation_reg execute_davros execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india product_validation_reg psim_psim

TC_Setup:
0. - DUT and Support device are RCS Capable and connected to LTE or WiFi network
- Have few image/audio/video files
- Chat features Status "Connected" on Messages settings
- "Messages" and "Carrier Services" apps updated
- Insert a SIM Card on DUT slot 2
- All interactions here must be made on SIM Card slot 2

Note: According to the Google guide, RCS on multi-SIMs devices should work only for one SIM at a time. Refer to IKSWQ-82591
TC_Steps:
0. Initiate a group chat and start conversation. Check for "is typing" message when other person is typing.  

1. Delete messages

2. Enable Delivery and read reports. Send some chat messages

3. Turn off WiFi, turn on Network data
4. Settings> chat feature> disable "send read receipts" 


5. Send a message to DUT, read it on DUT, and verify the "read receipts" feature on SUP
6. Disable "Auto-download files you receive over mobile data"
7. Receive a video/image/audio file
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Group conversation is successful. "...is typing" is displayed while the other person is typing

1. Selected messages are deleted

2. Delivered and Read indications are displayed as text in format "time sent/received - state"

3. Wifi should be off and Network data is on
4.  "send read receipts" should be disable
5. SUP must not be able to know if their message has been read or not
6.  "Auto-download files you receive over mobile data" should be disable
7. Files are not auto-downloaded.
TC_Labels: BB8 Latam_Reg MTK_Reg Plat_Reg common_validation_reg execute_davros execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india product_validation_reg psim_psim

TC_Setup:
0. - TC only applicable to NPIs Dual SIM 2020 wave 2 and onward
- Dual SIM Settings has call logs permission ON
- Have Latam Sim Card that enable the feature available. Insert It on DUT and enable Mobile Data.
- Have Wi-Fi network available but NOT connected
- Wi-Fi assistant is in its OOBE
- Set ro.carrier to any Latam carrier. See on root TC the Latam carriers list supported (List of ro.carrier with support the feature-6548.txt).

- NOTES : 
- If needed, to clean up the scenario, use adb shell pm clear com.motorola.msimsettings
- See on root TC, the list of MCC and MNC enabled to this feature(List of MNC and MCC enabled for this Feature.txt). Run the command adb shell getprop gsm.sim.operator.numeric to check the number of the SIM inserted on DUT and check if it there is on the list. If it is not in the list use other SIM compatible.
TC_Steps:
0. Connect to the Wi-Fi Network
1. Disable the Mobile Data within 10 minutes
2. Repeat the step 1 to 2, Verify the notification curtain for Wi-Fi assistant
3. Tap "Sure" in the notification
4. Tap "Settings" in the notification
5. Disconnect from Wi-Fi network and connect to Mobile Data
6. Connect to the Wi-Fi network
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Wi-Fi is sucessfully connected
1. Mobile is sucessfully disabled
2. Text on the notification should be seen as:
"Do you want to automatically turn data off when youre connected to any known Wi-Fi network?" with "Not now" and "Sure" options
3. Notification reloads and the contents is changed. It will be displayed "Mobile data will always turn off when youre connected to a Wi-Fi network" with "Settings" and "Got it" options
4. Wi-Fi preferences screen is opened and "Switch off data when connected to any Wi-Fi Network" option is enabled 
5. Wi-Fi is sucessfully disconnected and Mobile Data is sucessfully enabled
6. After Wi-Fi is connected, Mobile Data should be automatically disabled
TC_Labels: BB8 FEATURE-6548 Latam_Reg Mobile_data_assistant common_validation_reg execute_davros execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india network_dependent

TC_Setup:
0. - TC only applicable to NPIs Dual SIM 2020 wave 2 and onward
- Dual SIM Settings has call logs permission ON
- Have Latam Sim Card that enable the feature available. Insert It on DUT and enable Mobile Data.
- Have Wi-Fi network available but NOT connected
- Wi-Fi assistant is in its OOBE
- Set ro.carrier to any Latam carrier. See on root TC the Latam carriers list supported (List of ro.carrier with support the feature-6548.txt).

NOTES :
If needed, to clean up the scenario, use adb shell pm clear com.motorola.msimsettings
See on root TC, the list of MCC and MNC enabled to this feature(List of MNC and MCC enabled for this Feature.txt). Run the command adb shell getprop gsm.sim.operator.numeric to check the number of the SIM inserted on DUT and check if it there is on the list. If it is not in the list use other SIM compatible.
TC_Steps:
0. Connect to the Wi-Fi Network (wait until it is completely connected)

1. Disable the Mobile Data within 10 minutes
2. Disable WiFi and Enable mobile data
3. Repeat the steps 1 to 3 twice. Verify the notification curtain for Wi-Fi assistant
4. Tap "Sure" in the notification
5. Tap "Got it" in the notification
6. Disconnect from Wi-Fi network and connect to Mobile Data
7. Connect to the Wi-Fi network
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Connect to the Wi-Fi Network (wait until it is completely connected)

1.  Mobile is sucessfully disabled
2. WiFi is disconnected and Mobile data is connected
3. Text on the notification should be seen as: "Do you want to automatically turn data off when youre connected to any known Wi-Fi network?" with "Not now" and "Sure" options
4. Notification reloads and the content is changed. The notification should be seen as:
"Mobile data will always turn off when youre connected to a Wi-Fi network" with "Settings" and "Got it" options
5. Notifcations is dismissed 
6. Wi-Fi is sucessfully disconnected and Mobile Data is sucessfully enabled
7. After Wi-Fi is connected, Mobile Data should be automatically disabled
TC_Labels: BB8 FEATURE-6548 Latam_Reg Mobile_data_assistant common_validation_reg execute_davros execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india network_dependent

TC_Steps:
0. Move the date forward 8 days (From System settings)
1. Connect to WiFi and Manually disable the mobile data within 10 minutes of turning on the wifi

3. Enable Mobile data. Connect to WiFi and Manually disable the mobile data within 10 minutes of turning on the wifi.
4. Move the date to 8 days ago
5. Enable Mobile data. Connect to WiFi and Manually disable the mobile data within 10 minutes of turning on the wifi.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Date System is changed to forward 8 days without crashes or stranger behaviors
1. WiFi is connected successfully and Mobile data is disabled without crashes or stranger behaviors
2. Date System must back to today's date without crashes or stranger behaviors
3. Mobile data is enabled successfully. WiFi is connected and Mobile data is disabled without crashes or stranger behaviors
4. Date System must move the date to 8 days ago without crashes or stranger behaviors

5. Mobile data is enabled successfully. WiFi is connected and Mobile data is disabled without crashes or stranger behaviors. Mobile Assistant notification is seen under the notification curtain because the trigger was made 3 times in less 2 weeks

TC_Setup:
0. TC only applicable to NPIs Dual SIM 2020 wave 2 and onward
Dual SIM Settings has call logs permission ON
Have 2 Latam Sim Cards that enable the feature available. They are not inserted
Have Wi-Fi network available but NOT connected
Wi-Fi assistant is in its OOBE
Set ro.carrier to retbr

NOTES : 
If needed, to clean up the scenario, use adb shell pm clear com.motorola.msimsettings
- See on root TC, the list of MCC and MNC enabled to this feature( List of MNC and MCC enabled for this Feature.txt ). Run the command adb shell getprop gsm.sim.operator.numeric to check the number of the SIM inserted on DUT and check if it there is on the list. If it is not in the list use other SIM compatible.
TC_Steps:
0. No SIM Card inserted. Go to WiFi preferences under WiFi Settings and check by "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option

1. Insert a SIM Card on Slot1/Slot2 and Wait it camps. Go to WiFi preferences under WiFi Settings and check by "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option

2. Insert two SIM Cards on DUT, Wait both camps. Go to WiFi preferences under WiFi Settings and check by "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option
TC_Expected_Results:
0. "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option must not be present when no SIM Card inserted on DUT

1. "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option must be present when just one SIM Card inserted on DUT

2.  "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option must be present when two SIM Cards are inserted on DUT
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable Latam_Reg Mobile_data_assistant Plat_Reg common_validation_reg feature_mobile_data_assistant product_validation_reg psim_psim refactor

TC_Setup:
0. TC only applicable to NPIs Dual SIM 2020 wave 2 and onward
Dual SIM Settings has call logs permission ON 
Have 2 Latam Sim Cards that enable the feature available. They are not inserted 
Have Wi-Fi network available but NOT connected 
Wi-Fi assistant is in its OOBE 
Set ro.carrier to any Latam carrier(Not use retbr). See on root TCC the Latam carriers list supported (List of ro.carrier with support the feature-6548.txt).

NOTES : 
If needed, to clean up the scenario, use adb shell pm clear com.motorola.msimsettings
See on root TC, the list of MCC and MNC enabled to this feature(List of MNC and MCC enabled for this Feature.txt). Run the command adb shell getprop gsm.sim.operator.numeric to check the number of the SIM inserted on DUT and check if it there is on the list. If it is not in the list use other SIM compatible.
TC_Steps:
0. No SIM Card inserted. Go to WiFi preferences under WiFi Settings and check by "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option

1. Insert a SIM Card on Slot1/Slot2 and Wait it camps. Go to WiFi preferences under WiFi Settings and check by "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option

2. Insert two SIM Cards on DUT, Wait both camps. Go to WiFi preferences under WiFi Settings and check by "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option

3. Mobile Data enabled, Connect to WiFi available > Turn Off Mobile data

4. Disable Wi-Fi network

5. Repeat the Step 4 and follow Step 5 twice
TC_Expected_Results:
0. "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option must not be present when no SIM Card inserted on DUT

1. "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option must be present when just one SIM Card inserted on DUT

2.  "Switch off data when connected  to any Wi-Fi network" option must be present when just one SIM Card inserted on DUT

3. The user can turn ON Wifi and disable Mobile data without crashes or none stranger behavior

4. The user can turn Off Wifi without crashes or none stranger behavior

5. After the user Turns WiFi ON and disable Mobile data three times, mobile data assistant will be displayed on notification curtain: "Do you want to automatically turn data off  when you're connected to any Wi-Fi network?" with the buttons "Not Now" and "Sure". Dismiss action is NOT allowed on notification
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable Latam_Reg Mobile_data_assistant Plat_Reg common_validation_reg feature_mobile_data_assistant product_validation_reg psim_psim

TC_Setup:
0. Notes:

To disable the cable charging (for battery saver):

adb shell dumpsys battery unplug

To check the display brightness value run:
adb shell dumpsys display
Check for mScreenAutoBrightness, when it is set to 256, HBM should enable in normal conditions.

To check the HBM status by one of the commands:
Older devices: 
adb shell
logcat -b kernel | grep "Set HBM to "
Android S: adb shell dumpsys display | findstr "mIsHbmTrigger"
Output: mIsHbmTrigger=true or =false
Android T: adb shell dumpsys display | findstr "mHbmStatsState"
Output: mHbmStatsState=HBM_OFF or HBM_ON_SUNLIGHT

Android sensor app is installed on device (from playstore).

More details can be found here: MCA-747
TC_Steps:
0. Display is on. Point a flashlight close to brightness sensor and check on Android sensor the current lux value on sensor (should be 10.000 or above).


1. Run the command adb shell dumpsys display and check  mScreenAutoBrightness, if it is on 256, it should enable the HBM in normal conditions.

2. Run command to check HBM state
3. Turn OFF the screen, wait a couple minutes then Turn ON the device scree
4. Now verify HBM under these conditions:

A. When phone backlight is turned off 
B. With always on display (AOD) is breathing.
TC_Expected_Results:
1. HBM mode shall turns on for 60 sec maximum if display is on during this time. Also it shouldn't be turn on again during the same display on session, e.g the display has to be turned off before HBM triggers again.



2. HBM state shall returns 1
4. For A and B conditions HBM shouldn't be triggered.
Command for HBM state should return 0.
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable Core_Reg Display_2ndSource PRC_PRC PRC_Pickup Plat_Reg binary_leverage common_validation_reg feature_display no_efficiency non_network_dependent product_validation_reg quick_regression

TC_Setup:
1. "Phone is new HW, or after Settings UI FDR(Authorized FDR).

Starting on Android 8.1, user can bypass FRP by entering the lockscreen pattern/Pin/password previously configured on device

Note: Test Google accounts should be older than 72 hours, and whose password is not changed during 72 hours.
====
Google requirement: There will be a 72-hour lockdown following a Google account password reset
before the device can be unlocked with the new password. This is to allow time
for the owner to recover the lost password and re-lock the device when both the
account credentials and the device have been stolen."

Kill Switch/anti-theft is based on Google account setup, so skip Google account setup during setup wizard is equal to disable anti-theft, there should be warning on the (next) protect your phone screen.
If the user decides to skip lockscreen protection during setup, he is reminded that anti-theft will not be activated on the device.
The user can learn more about anti-theft protection from the learn more link.

2. To activate and meet the legal requirements of FDRP:
The user has to set-up a Google account (during OOB setup) on the device
The user is also prompted to set up a lockscreen protection.
Once the Google account is setup, a token for this account is written to the secure datablock"
TC_Steps:
0. PLEASE READ CAREFULLY: Kill Switch is a security feature, we need to have special attention on running security tests in order to guarantee that no backdoors or bypasses will escape. Please spend some effort on looking for security flaws going beyond our test cases specification if possible
1. 1. Skip Google account setup during setup wizard.
2. Skip lockscreen protection during setup
3. Return to the start of setup wizard
4. Go thorough setup wizard, this time setup Google account and lockscreen, Kill Switch setup finish
TC_Expected_Results:
1. 1. There should be warning on the (next) protect your phone screen.
2. user is reminded that anti-theft will not be activated on the device.
4. user which has logged-in the Google account during setup, and set-up a lockscreen PIN now has 
 - Factory reset protection based on his Google ID
 - Android Device Manager (Lock & Wipe)
 - PIN/lockscreen protection
Also check that below actions requires the PIN to be performed
 - Addition of new Google account from the device
 - Removal of the last Google account from the device
 - Access to the factory reset from settings
 - Ability to Enable OEM unlock (unlock the bootloader) (off by default)
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable Core_Reg EDA_updated binary_leverage common_line common_validation_reg difficulty_level_high no_efficiency10 non_network_dependent secure_hw

TC_Setup:
0. This test is recomended to be executed with a Secure HW

Phone has Kill Switch setup with Google account and screen lock set to Pattern/PIN/Password

Starting on Android 8.1, user can bypass FRP by entering the lockscreen pattern/Pin/password previously configured on device

Note: Test Google accounts should be older than 72 hours, and whose password is not changed during 72 hours.
====
Google requirement: There will be a 72-hour lockdown following a Google account password reset
before the device can be unlocked with the new password. This is to allow time
for the owner to recover the lost password and re-lock the device when both the
account credentials and the device have been stolen."
TC_Steps:
0. PLEASE READ CAREFULLY: Kill Switch is a security feature, we need to have special attention on running security tests in order to guarantee that no backdoors or bypasses will escape. Please spend some effort on looking for security flaws going beyond our test cases specification if possible
1. 1. Make an un-authorized FDR to enable FRP, such as :
 - cable (fastboot -w)
 - recovery mode option (bootloader)
 - any device administrator (android device manager, lookout, moto protect)

2. Try to setup device again on setup wizard
TC_Expected_Results:
1. 2. When trying to setup the device again, the person in possession of the device will be challenged to provide the Google credentials or the lockscreen of the previous owner of the device, before being able to proceed through setup. 
A data (or WiFi) connection will be necessary to proceed.
Only emergency calls and messages will be permitted.

The only way to activate the device is to enter the google credentials or the lockscreen of the previous owner.

Check During Setup Wizard, before user input any challenge info, user can NOT access Setting or Quick Settings and make Authorized FDR, which will break the protection feature. IKSWL-1139

Adb should be disabled by default for User signed or User signed CID build. So ADB command can't access phone while doing Setup wizard.

Only previous lockscreen password or the Google account credentials can recover from FRP

TC_Setup:
0. Install a application that ask permission of camera, microphone and location (Whatsapp, Telegram, etc.)
NoteFor PRC productusing Wechat,QQ,etc.
TC_Steps:
0. Try to use camera, microphone or location resource from the application

1. Deny the permission

2. Close and open application and try to use the same resource again

3. Deny the permission again

4. Close and open application and try to use the same resource one more time

5. Go to app setting and clear the storage and the cache

6. Open the application and try to use camera, microphone or location resource once again
TC_Expected_Results:
0. The device should ask the permission and three options are shown: While using the app, Only this time and Deny
1. The usage of resource is denied and can't use it

2. The permission should be asked again and a permission screen is shown with "Deny and Allow/Continue" options
3. The usage of resource is denied and can't use it

4. The Permissions are always requested, with the options Deny and Allow/Continue (same behavior as Pixel)
6. The device should ask the permissions again
TC_Labels: Android_R Core_Reg PRC_PRC PRC_Pickup Plat_Reg common_validation_reg feature_app_notification non_network_dependent product_validation_reg quick_regression

0. 1. Go to Settings > Network & internet > Mobile network > Preferred network type > check the available options.
2. Observe the default selected option.
1. 3. Wait DUT register on the network.
2. 4. Wait DUT register on the network.
5. Select "LTE/CDMA" > wait DUT register on the network.
6. Select "CDMA" > wait DUT register on the network.
7. Select "GSM/UMTS" > wait DUT register on the network.
8. Register on different networks, make a call, send a message, and browse web via SIM data.

0. 1. The available network types shall be:
- Automatic
- LTE/CDMA
- CDMA
- GSM/UMTS
2. By default, "Automatic" shall be selected, and all options are selectable.
1. 3. If under NR coverage but IMS is not registered, UE will switch to SRLTE mode. Make sure that the device register on LTE network.
2. 4. If under NR coverage and IMS is registered, UE will get NR service (scan NSA bands). Make sure that the device register on the 5G network.
5. Device shall disconnect from current network and shall register on the selected network type. Make sure that the device register on the LTE network.
6. Device shall disconnect from current network and shall register on the selected network type. Make sure that the device register on the 3G network.
7. Device shall disconnect from current network and shall register on the selected network type. Make sure that the device register on proper network.
8. Call, message, data should work fine.

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Wifi is connected
2. One Google Account is registered on device
3. Backup is enabled on Settings
4. Execute command adb root to be able to run commands
5. Wallpaper backup package = com.android.wallpaperbackup
TC_Steps:
0. 1. Take a new picture and set as homescreen wallpaper
1. 2. Google Backup Transport is available and active. 

Use command: adb shell bmgr list transports

2. 3. Add Wallpaper Backup package to the Backup Manager's queue. 

Use command: adb shell bmgr backupnow com.android.wallpaperbackup
3. 4. Verify Wallpaper backup is on ""Pending key/value backup list"": 

Use command: adb shell dumpsys backup

4. 5. Initiate the backup operation, which forces the Backup Manager to perform all backup requests that are in its queue:

Use command: adb shell bmgr run 

Repeat command to verify Wallpaper backup is NOT on "Pending key/value backup list" anymore

Use command: adb shell dumpsys backup
5. 6. Take logcat for a couple of minutes to be able to catch backup for wallpaper package.

Use command adb logcat > log.txt (Use ""ctrl+c"" to stop taking log)


6. 7. Perform FDR on device


7. 8. On Setup Wizard screen, set a wifi connection, select option to backup from cloud, set account used as backup & restore account, select latest backup performed and finish setup wizard flow until reach homescreen.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 1. Picture is set as homescreen wallpaper
1. 2. Following log is returned on console:

"android/com.android.internal.backup.LocalTransport
* com.google.android.gms/.backup.BackupTransportService"
2. 3. Following log is displayed on console at the end of proccess. No error message is displayed on console.

"Package com.android.wallpaperbackup with result: Success
Backup finished with result: Success"
3. 4. Package com.android.wallpaperbackup is listed on ""Pending key/value backup""


4. 5. Wallpaper backup package is NOT on ""Pending key/value backup list"" anymore


5. 6. Check logs contains below similar system logs:
.......................................
D PerformBackupTask: Starting full backups for: [com.android.wallpaperbackup]
........................................
I PFTBT   : Initiating full-data transport backup of com.android.wallpaperbackup 
.......................................
D BackupManagerService: agentConnected pkg=com.android.wallpaperbackup agent=android.app.backup.BackupAgent$BackupServiceBinder@5dedf46
.......................................
D BackupManagerService: Calling doFullBackup() on com.android.wallpaperbackup
.......................................
I Backup  : [GmsBackupTransport] Backup finished for com.android.wallpaperbackup
...................................................

6. 7. FDR is perfomed and setup wizard screen is displayed


7. 8. Wallpaper set on step 1 is displayed on homescreen successfully.
TC_Labels: Android_O_updated BB8_not_applicable Core_Reg EDA_updated binary_leverage common_line common_validation_reg difficulty_level_high non_network_dependent

If set low, should prevent from false touch on edges, should not feel the touch on edge content
If set medium, should not allow to touch contents shown on edges, normal touches on edge content
If set high, should allows to touch contents shown on edges, high sensitive touches on edge content
4. User should not feel any touch event on edges while touch on the content near to edges.
5. After reboot the device verify the sensivity level, Edge sensitivity level should be same as like before reboot there should be no changes on that.
