TC_Setup:
0. 1. T-Mobile/ATT SIM Card inserted. 
2. DUT camped over a LTE Home network or Wi-Fi. 
3. DUT and Support device shall be RCS capable (UP1.0) and IMS registered. 
4. Google account added to the device.
5. Wi-Fi off to avoid upgrading the Messaging app early.
6. MotoMessaging app update available on Play Store, or, the "Messaging-rcs-release.apk" downloaded from https://jenkins-scm.mot.com/view/Apps/view/MotoMessaging/.

Note: make sure that the downloaded apk version is newer than the preloaded app.
TC_Steps:
0. 1. Go to Messages > Start a 1:1 Chat > DUT 1 send a text chat to the DUT 2. 
2. From DUT 1, send a File transfer file to the DUT 2. 
3. From DUT 2, reply a text chat to the DUT 1. 
4. From DUT 2, reply a File transfer file to the DUT 1. 
5. Connect to WiFi, and update the AOSP MotoMessaging via Play Store, or, perform the Moto Messages app update by running the following commands:
adb root
adb remount
adb install -r Messaging-rcs-debug.apk

6. After the update, open Messages app and check the previous 1:1 Chat conversation.
7. After the update, repeat steps 2 to 4 and make sure that RCS is still working fine.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 1. The 1:1 chat shall be created and the text content shall be sent as "Chat".
2. Multimedia File transfer shall be sent properly. Verify in the message details that messages are sent as "File Transfer". 
3. The text chat shall be received properly. Verify in the message details that DUT1 received as "Chat". 
4. The multimedia file transfer shall be received properly. Verify in the message details that DUT1 received as "File transfer". 
5. The Moto Messages app shall be updated.
6. The previous 1:1 Chat conversation shall be retained and it shall contains all the contents prior the udpate. 
7. After the update, RCS shall continue working properly. The UP1.0 capability icon (light blue conversation bubble) shall be displayed along with the contact. Text contents sent/received as "Chat" and multimedia contents sent/received as "File transfer". Make sure that while typing, the "isTyping..." indicator shall be displayed. Also, make sure that the Delivery and Read report are properly updated after reading the messages.
TC_Labels: FEATURE-6625 common_validation_reg execute_davros execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india execute_femtocell_tmo network_dependent rcs_tmo

TC_Setup:
0. - Have 2 SIM Cards inserted in the device
- Test device in an area that have 4G, 3G and 2G coverage
- Phone should be connected to Wifi
TC_Steps:
0. Go to SIM Cards and set Cellular data to SIM1. 
1. Go back to Network & Internet settings
2. Check RAT (Radio Access Technology - 4G, 3G, 2G) icon on Status bar and Quick Settings over each SIM Card
3. Check "Data Warning & Limit" for SIM1 and SIM2 
4. Turn OFF Wifi and repeat steps 3 and 4
5. Turn On Wifi
6. Go back to  Mobile network  and set Preferred network type of SIM2 (the secondary/non-data SIM) to 2G.
7. Repeat steps 3, 4 and 5
8. Repeat test case using Wi-Fi Off and switching Data SIM Card to SIM2
TC_Expected_Results:
0. SIM1 is set for data
1. Check Preferred Network is 4G for SIM1 (Data SIM) and is 3G for SIM2 (non-data SIM)
2. SIM1 should have 4G/3G/2G greyed icon (if connected to Wi-Fi network), same as selected on preferred network type.
According with IKSWN-3745, icon of non-data SIM should not appear.

Note : For NPI's : The network type of the non data SIM card is default as 4G.
3. For SIM1: "Data warning & limit" is displayed correctly, it's possible to select and change the values. For SIM2: "Data warning & limit" is greyed out. 
4. Default Data SIM Card, which is SIM1 should have 4G (white icon) and non-Default Data SIM Card should not appear (According with IKSWN-3745)
6. Preferred Network for SIM 2 should be changeable and 2G and 3G options should be available.
2G option should be selected
7. SIM1 should have the same behavior of steps 3, 4 and 5 but SIM2 should not show 2G icon.
TC_Labels: Android_O_updated Android_Q_updated DSDS_Reg PRC_MSimSettings PRC_PRC PRC_Pickup Plat_Reg common_validation_reg execute_local_network feature_DSDS no_efficiency product_validation_reg psim_esim requires_dual_sim

TC_Setup:
0. Phone has some 3rd Calendar apps.

Here we just us Brazil timezone as example:
 - http://www.timeanddate.com/time/change/brazil/sao-paulo?year=2015
 - Feb 22, 2015 - Daylight Saving Time Ended
 - Oct 18, 2015 - Daylight Saving Time Starts

Note: For this test it's necessary to initiate the device without any SIM card and Wi-fi connection, since the time from device is established from network
TC_Steps:
0. 1. Turn off phone Automatic time zone, automatic date & time; And Airplane mode on phone; phone no WiFi connection.

2. Change phone timezone to the country which has daylight saving, or the country which phone will release.
Here we use Brazil as example.

3.  Check Daylight Saving Time Ended
 - set phone time 10:59PM and date 2/21/2015, phone should show it's summer time.
 - Wait for 1 HOUR and 2 minutes, phone should show 11:01PM and standard time 2/21/2015 

4. Check Daylight Saving Time Starts
 - set phone time 11:59PM and date 10/17/2015, phone should show it's standard time.
 - Wait for 2 minutes, phone should show 1:01AM and summer time 10/18/2015
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 3. Phone works without crash/FC, freeze ANR and so on, When Daylight Saving Time Ended

4. Phone works without crash/FC, freeze ANR and so on, when Daylight Saving Time Starts.
TC_Labels: Android_O_updated BB8_not_applicable Core_Reg EDA_updated binary_leverage common_validation_reg difficulty_level_high long_duration low_pri_auto network_leverage no_efficiency10

2. The app content should be shown properly for security units or non-security units with Widevine keys provisioned

5. The secondary user setup is finished if it has not been done previously
6. The primary user is loaded correctly

5. Stop screen recording and check the video
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Recording works as expected and no issues are seen

1. Recording is stopped and saved. Audio from the microphone is captured on the recording during the intervals where audio mode includes microphone.

2. Microphone access is blocked

3. When swapping to an option with microphone included, a popup (or notification) is seen warning the user about the access block and with options to unblock or cancel
4. Microphone access continues blocked

5. Audio from the microphone is not captured on the recording
TC_Labels: Android_S Core_Reg common_validation_reg execute_local_non_network product_validation_reg

1. Upgrade the DUT to the target build

TC_Setup:
0. - Have some apps installed in the internal memory via PS store like games, social apps, photo editor, etc.
- Open installed app, enable permissions and use for a while


4. NOTE: To get the PACKAGE_NAME of the app, go to App Info > App Details > Three-Dot Menu > Share. The package name should be displayed at the end of the share link, eg: the package name of Google Chrome app is com.android.chrome
TC_Steps:
0. Go to Phone Settings > Storage > Apps and check the storage space used for the app that will go into hibernation

1. Touch and hold an app installed and tap the app info option

2. Enable the option "Remove permissions and free up space" in the "Unused applications" menu

3. Enable the hibernation behavior on the device: 
adb shell device_config put app_hibernation app_hibernation_enabled true

4. Change application state to hibernation:
adb shell cmd app_hibernation set-state PACKAGE_NAME true
adb shell device_config put permissions auto_revoke_unused_threshold_millis2 1000
adb shell am wait-for-broadcast-idle
adb shell cmd jobscheduler run -u 0 -f com.google.android.permissioncontroller 2
(Note: PRC uses com.android.permissioncontroller instead of com.google.android.permissioncontroller)
5. Go to Phone Settings > Apps > Unused Apps and check if the app is in the list

6. Go to Phone settings > Storage again and check if the space used has been optimized

7. Go to the app tray and check the unused app
TC_Expected_Results:
0. The storage used is shown

1. The app info screen is shown

2. The "Remove permissions and free up space" option is enabled

3. The hibernation mode of the device is enabled

4. The hibernation state of the app is enabled

5. The app is in the list of unused apps

6. The space used has been optimized

7. - The app is still installed on the device and can be opened 
- The permissions are removed 
- After opening the app, it is removed from the list of unused apps
TC_Labels: Android_S Core_Reg common_validation_reg execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india execute_local_non_network product_validation_reg

TC_Setup:
0. - DUT is flashed on base build 
- OTA upgrade campaign is ready to be downloaded
- Have some apps installed via PS store like games, social apps, photo editor, etc.
- Open installed app, enable permissions and use for a while


6. NOTE: To get the PACKAGE_NAME of the app, go to App Info > App Details > Three-Dot Menu > Share. The package name should be displayed at the end of the share link, eg: the package name of Google Chrome app is com.android.chrome
7. It is necessary to execute the following commands to remove unused apps permissions:

$adb shell device_config put permissions auto_revoke_unused_threshold_millis2 1000
$adb shell am wait-for-broadcast-idle
$adb shell cmd jobscheduler run -u 0 -f com.google.android.permissioncontroller 2
(Note: PRC uses com.android.permissioncontroller instead of com.google.android.permissioncontroller)
TC_Steps:
0. In source build, touch and hold an app installed and tap the app info option

1. Enable the option "Remove permissions if app ins't used" in the "Permissions" menu

2. Upgrade the DUT to the target build

3. After the upgrade, make sure the option "Remove permissions and free up space" in the "Unused applications" menu remains enabled

4. Go to Phone Settings > Storage > Apps and check the storage space used for the app that will go into hibernation

5. Enable the hibernation behavior on the device: 
adb shell device_config put app_hibernation app_hibernation_enabled true

6. Change application state to hibernation:
adb shell cmd app_hibernation set-state PACKAGE_NAME true

7. Go to Phone Settings > Apps > Unused Apps and check if the app is in the list

8. Go to Phone settings > Storage again and check if the space used has been optimized

9. Go to the app tray and check the unused app
TC_Expected_Results:
0. The app info screen is shown.

1. The option "Remove permissions if app ins't used" is enabled

2. DUT is upgraded to target build, no crashes or abnormal behaviors are seen

3. The "Remove permissions and free up space" option is enabled

4. The storage used is shown

5. The hibernation mode of the device is enabled

6. The hibernation state of the app is enabled

7. The app is in the list of unused apps

8. The space used has been optimized

9. - The app is still installed on the device and can be opened
- The permissions are removed
- After opening the app, it is removed from the list of unused apps
TC_Labels: Android_S Core_Data_Migration Plat_Reg common_validation_reg execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india execute_local_non_network product_validation_reg

TC_Setup: 0. Initial state: Device is not breathing. For Device that Approach for Motodisplay is supported you have to disable on Moto -> Actions -> Approach for Motodisplay in order to Nudge gesture works. (Example of devices that it's need to disable Approach for Moto Display: Eagle, Houdini, Vector, Vertex, Ibis).
TC_Steps:
0. Ensure it is not breathing For nudge, you must be motionless for 5 seconds. Note: Holding the device in your hand WILL have motion, you need to have it completely still. - This gesture is used to invoke breath - Only uses the Accelerometer - The precondition is that device does not move at all for 5 seconds - Algorithm takes up to 1 second to trigger breath 
1. IF: (5 seconds of no movement) AND (Followed by significant movement for 1-2 seconds) 
2. Change device to battery saver mode -> then turn display off -> perform nudge gesture
TC_Expected_Results:
1. Verify it force a single breath. 
2. Verify it force a singe breath when perform a nudge gesture. For AoD 3.0 build L: The breath takes around 4 seconds For AoD 3.0 or 4.0 build M: The breath takes around 3 seconds For AoD 6.0 build N and O: The breath takes around 3 seconds
TC_Labels: Exp_Reg Plat_Reg common_validation_reg exp_common feature_common feature_nudge feature_peek_display non_network_dependent nudge pick_by_platform prc_leverage product_validation_reg quick_regression

TC_Setup:
0. Make sure a test number is set to replace the real emergency number:
Run: 
adb root
adb shell cmd phone emergency-number-test-mode -a <testPhoneNumber>
adb shell setprop ril.test.emergencynumber 190:<testPhoneNumber>

- On android S, the feature MUST be disabled by default (IKSWS-99190).
- From Android T onwards, make sure Emergency SOS is on by default.
TC_Steps:
0. On settings page, switch ON the countdown alarm.

1. Quickly press the Power Button 5 times.

2. On countdown screen, swipe to cancel the call.

3. On settings page, switch OFF the countdown alarm.

4. Quickly press the Power Button 5 times.

5. On countdown screen, swipe to cancel the call.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 'Play countdown alarm' option can be set to ON.

1. Emergency SOS is triggered. A loud alarm rings during countdown. Screen shows countdown and the emergency number that will be called. 

2. Emergency call is canced and alarm stops.

3. 'Play countdown alarm' option can be set to OFF.

4. Emergency SOS is triggered. DUT doesn't ring during countdown. Screen shows countdown and the emergency number that will be called. 

5. Emergency call is canced.
TC_Labels: Android_S Android_T_updated Core_Reg common_validation_reg execute_local_network_brazil execute_local_network_china execute_local_network_india

adb root

TC_Steps:

1. Set a Screen Lock method (PIN, Pattern, Password)

2. Lock the screen. Then, quickly press the Power Button 5 times.

NoteFor ro.carrier "retin",quickly press the Power Button 3 timesThis is a regulatory requirement in India where triple press power key would launch emergency call and this feature overrides the 5 times power key press
3. Remove the Screen Lock method.

4. Quickly press the Power Button 5 times.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. After tapping on option, a pop up asks for a custom emergency number. If the field is empty, default emergency number is displayed.

1. Screen Lock method is set.

2. Emergency SOS is triggered. Screen shows countdown and the emergency number that will be called. After countdown, the call is placed to the support phone, and PIN/Password is NOT requested.

3. Screen Lock method is None or Swipe.

4. Emergency SOS is triggered and the call is placed to the support phone.

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Do FDR and Set up device as Device Owner Mode and complete setup 
2. Install latest Moto OEM Config

TC_Steps:
0. Launch the Motorola OemConfig app and press home button 

1. Open the TestDPC and Search for "Managed Configurations"

2. Search for OemConfig (or Moto OEMConfig) 

3. Tap on the edit icon of "customization policies" and then tap on "Configure" 

4. Tap on the edit icon of "device Wallpaper" and then tap on "Configure" 

5. Tap on the edit icon of WallpaperScreen" and change "Select type" to String then type any(1,2,3) on the value field.

6. Tap on the edit icon of WallpaperURLWeb" and change "Select type" to String then type "valid url pattern" on the value field. Keep tapping on the "Save" buttons until a toast is displayed 

7. Open lock screen, Home screen or both (based on select string value) of device
TC_Expected_Results:
0. OEMConfig app runs in background. 

1. Managed Configurations with menu options are displayed. 

2. OemConfig screen is shown. 

3. language set, device Wallpaper should be displayed. 

4. WallpaperScreen, WallpaperURlWeb should be displayed.

5. Toast message should display and the value is set.

6. There is a toast message 'No network connection to set wallpaper'.

7. The wallpaper is not changed and wallpaper related to updated URL should not appear.
TC_Labels: Core_Reg FEATURE-7363 Plat_Reg common_validation_reg feature_thinkshield

TC_Setup:
0. Have some contents in Internal memory, SD card USB.

TC_Steps:
0. 1. Move few files from Internal memory to SD card and vice versa. Also try to copy/delete content on SD card.

3. Move files from SD card to USB and vice versa
4. Remove the SD card (No ongoing transfers)
5. Remove the USB drive (No ongoing transfers)
6. Re-insert the SDcard/USB 
7. Go to Settings > Storage and USB > Portable Storage - Eject/Unmount SDcard
8. Go to Settings > Storage and USB > Portable Storage - Eject/Unmount USB
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 1. Files are removed from Internal memory and are now present in SD card and vice versa. Able to copy/delete content on SD card
2.  Files are removed from Internal memory and are now present in USB and vice versa.
3.  Files are removed from SD card and are now present in USB  and vice versa.
  Note: Skip USB transfer for the devices that do not support OTG/USB

4. SD card contents are not shown in the File Manager
5.  USB drive files are not shown in the File Manager
6. SD card/USB files are displayed again in File Manager

7. SD card is ejected/unmounted and no more listed under File Manager
8. USB is ejected/unmounted and no more listed under File Manager

NOTE: Verify some abnormal behavior like: Notifications sounds, screen flicker or any other strange behavior during file transfer.

TC_Setup:
0. - The phone and Display are connected via HDMI/USB-C ports as Mobile desktop

This test case is only applicable if all the conditions below are met:
- The phone must support HDCP. It may also be dependable on the PVT HW version.
- HDCP is not supported for legacy devices that are getting R4 Wireless via A12 OS Upgrade which in this case are Tahoe (Nio) and Edge+ (Burton)
- This TC MUST be performed with Non-CID0 secure HW. otherwise use a specially prepared phone with the Widevine keys provisioned
TC_Steps:
0. After connecting to the external monitor/display as Mobile desktop, download Disney+ app on Play Store.

1. Launch Experience hub, then select TV mode
2. Launch Disney+ app and tap a DRM protected video to watch
3. Make the DUT screen off by tapping power button or waiting for the DUT screen time out when playing video, then play video for 20 minutes
TC_Expected_Results:
0. The app can be downloaded successfully

1. TV mode is launched properly and streaming apps are listed on screen.
2. The app content should be shown properly for security units or non-security units with Widevine keys provisioned
The protected video is playing normally.
3. The DUT screen is off, and the video plays normally, the DUT don't restart or ramdump etc. no abnormal behavior can be observed.
TC_Labels: Exp_Reg METASCRUM-681 common_validation_reg feature_product feature_readyfor feature_readyfor_wired non_network_dependent prc_leverage product_validation_reg secure_hw

TC_Setup:
0. - The phone and Display are connected via WiFi

This test case is only applicable if all the conditions below are met:
- The phone must support HDCP. It may also be dependable on the PVT HW version.
- HDCP is not supported for legacy devices that are getting R4 Wireless via A12 OS Upgrade which in this case are Tahoe (Nio) and Edge+ (Burton)
- This TC MUST be performed with Non-CID0 secure HW. Otherwise use a specially prepared phone with the Widevine keys provisioned
TC_Steps:
0. After connecting to the external monitor/display as Mirror mode, download Disney+ app on Play Store.
1. Launch downloaded streaming app and tap to watch a video
2. Make the DUT screen off by tapping power button while protected video is streaming.
3. Make the DUT screen on by tapping power button then play video for 20 minutes.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. DUT can be connected on Mirror mode, and the app can be downloaded successfully
1. The app content should be shown properly for security units or non-security units with Widevine keys provisioned
2. The DUT screen is off and it doesn't appear to restart or ramdump, etc. no abnormal behavior can be observed
3. The DUT screen is on and video can be played normally, and no strange behavior can be observed during execution.
TC_Labels: Exp_Reg METASCRUM-681 common_validation_reg feature_product feature_readyfor feature_readyfor_wireless non_network_dependent prc_leverage product_validation_reg secure_hw

TC_Setup:
0. - The phone and Display are connected via Wi-Fi as Mobile desktop

This test case is only applicable if all the conditions below are met:
- The phone must support HDCP. It may also be dependable on the PVT HW version.
- HDCP is not supported for legacy devices that are getting R4 Wireless via A12 OS Upgrade which in this case are Tahoe (Nio) and Edge+ (Burton)
- Preferable to must use Non-cid0 Secure phone, such as cid50/cid11 etc., otherwise use a specially prepared phone with the Widevine keys provisioned
TC_Steps:
0. After connecting to the external monitor/display as Mobile desktop, download Google TV app in the Play Store, if not preloaded.

1.  Launch Experience hub, then select TV mode

2. Launch Google TV app and tap a DRM protected video to watch

3. Make the DUT screen off by tapping power button or waiting for the DUT screen time out when playing video, then play video 20 minutes
TC_Expected_Results:
0. The app can be downloaded successfully

1. TV mode is launched properly and streaming apps are listed on screen.


2. The app content should be shown properly for security units or non-security units with Widevine keys provisioned
The protected content can be played normally.

3. The DUT screen is off and it doesn't appear to restart or ramdump, etc., no abnormal behavior can be observed.
TC_Labels: Exp_Reg METASCRUM-681 common_validation_reg feature_product feature_readyfor feature_readyfor_wireless non_network_dependent prc_leverage product_validation_reg secure_hw

TC_Setup: 0. DUT must be set in English as primary language
TC_Steps:
0. In Settings, set a language different from English to Clock application (e.g. Espaol)

1. Launch Clock application

2. In Clock application, set 2 alarms two minutes difference them

3. Hit the power button to lock the screen

4. Press the power button

5. At this point, the first alarm will ring

6. Drag the alarm button to right to Stop ringing

7. Unlock the screen and wait for the second alarm previously set to ring

8. On heads up notification, tap on Stop button
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Clock language application must be displayed according to the setup language (in this case Espaol)

1. The Clock application with be displayed in Spanish (as chosen language)

2. There must display a snackbar (in Spanish) with the time remaining to sound the alarm and will disappear automatically

3. The light will be turned off

4. In AOD area, a pushnotification from Clock application will be displayed with informations about the alarms just created in the chosen language (in this case Espaol)

5. A fullscreen alarm will be displayed in Spanish language

6. A fullscreen notification will be displayed warning about the alarm deactivation (in Spanish language)

7. When the second alarm rings, a heads up notification with information about the time schedule set (in Spanish)

8. The notification will be closed and alarm will be deactivated
TC_Labels: AOSP_Reg Android_T common_validation_reg execute_davros_brazil non_network_dependent

TC_Setup:
0. - DUT is registered on 5G Network
- There is a WiFi AP remembered on device
- WiFi is off
TC_Steps:
0. Launch browser and start to download a big file (size > 10Gb)

1. While file is being downloaded, Move away from 5G to 4G only network
10. While file is being uploaded, turn WiFi on in order to switch to Wifi data

11. Turn WiFi off
12. Turn WiFi on again
13. Drop Wifi by turning off AP or router
14. Repeat the (10-14) steps above by uploading several files (total > 10Gb)
2. While file is being downloaded, Turn on Wifi and connect to a Wifi AP.

3. Move away from 4G to 5G only network
4. Turn WiFi off
5. Turn WiFi on again
6. Drop Wifi by turning off AP or router
7. Repeat steps above downloading several files at same time
8. Go to Mobile Data > Data Usage
9. Start to upload a big file (size > 10Gb)
TC_Expected_Results:
1. DUT data shall switch to 4G network without Modem Silent Panics or any other related Bug2go issue. 
Download shall keep ongoing without issues
10. While file is being uploaded, turn WiFi on in order to switch to Wifi data

11. WiFi shall switch back to 5G data. Upload shall keep ongoing without issues
12. 5G data shall switch to WiFi network. Upload shall keep ongoing without issues
13. WiFi shall switch to 5G data. Upload shall keep ongoing without issues
14. Upload shall occur without issues. no currupted files or breakages of uploads shall be noticed
2. DUT data shall switch to WiFi network without Modem Silent Panics or any other related Bug2go issue. 
Download shall keep ongoing without issues
3. DUT data shall switch to 5G network without Modem Silent Panics or any other related Bug2go issue. 
Download shall keep ongoing without issues
4. WiFi shall switch back to 5G data. Download shall keep ongoing without issues
5. 5G Data shall switch to WiFi network. Download shall keep ongoing without issues
6. WiFi shall switch to 5G data. Download shall keep ongoing without issues
7. Downloads shall finishes while switching between technologies with no corrupted files
8. Verify that downloaded file data is distributed on Wifi Data usage and Mobile data usage
TC_Labels: 5G_NR 5G_Reg Latam_5G_Reg Plat_Reg common_validation_reg execute_davros_china feature_5G product_validation_reg

TC_Setup:
0. 1. T-Mobile SIM Card inserted. 
2. Make sure SIM used is subscribed for Premium voicemail on TMO (NVVM whitelisted). 
3. "Auto-download" option is OFF (Phone > 3 dots menu > Settings > Visual Voicemail).
Note: NVVM means Native Visual Voicemail (Integrated VVM in Phone).
TC_Steps:
0. Receive a voicemail (audio in english) from support device. 

1. Go to Phone > Voicemail > expand the received voicemail > check if "Translate" option is available. 

2. Tap to play the voicemail. 

3. Tap on Translate 

4. Turn ON "Auto download" option in Visual Voicemail settings, receive a voicemail (audio in english) from support device. 

5. Go to Phone > Voicemail > expand the received voicemail > check if "Translate" option is available and observe the inline transcript language. 

6. Go to Phone > overflow > Settings > Visual Voicemail > Voicemail translation, select a non-default language and Update. 

7. Receive a voicemail (audio in english) from support device. 

8. Open the received voicemail > observe the inline transcript language.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. DUT must receive and notify the new voicemail message. 

1. Since "auto-download" is OFF, the option must not be displayed. 

2. After downloading the voicemail, the option "Translate" must be added into the expanded view option list, and also, the inline transcript must be displayed. 

3. The window "Select language" must be displayed containing a list of languages. 

4. DUT must receive and notify the new voicemail message. 

5. The "Translate" option must be available, and the inline transcript must be displayed. The inline transcript must be displayed in english, since the global settings is set to english. 

6. The user must be able to select any language in the available list. After selecting Update, the toast "Language update successfuly" must be displayed and the new selected language must be displayed as a subtitle of the option "Voicemail translation". 

7. DUT must receive and notify the new voicemail message. 

8. The new voicemail must be received and the inline transcript must be translated to the selected language, accoding to the global voicemail setting.
TC_Labels: FEATURE-7711 TMO_Reg common_validation_reg execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india

TC_Setup:
0. It's necessary 3 devices: 
- DUT: this device will be treated as the Target device (the one that will RECEIVE the data transfer)
- Source: this device will be treated as the Source device (the one that will SEND the data transfer). In case DUT is at the same Android OS than Source, it is preferred they should be the same product
- SUP: any support device

On Source device:
- Must have a SIM Card inserted
- Must have a SD Card inserted with the same data mass located on the following drive: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/15eUkFpvGWj0EfthA3OKXB7Ppl6fGIo4b => DataMass from SD Card
- Must have the same data mass located on the following drive: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/15eUkFpvGWj0EfthA3OKXB7Ppl6fGIo4b => DataMass-5GB
- Must have SMS, Google Calendar, iMessages, SMS, MMS text and associated media, Third-party apps for iOS, Local contacts,SIM contacts, WhatsApp messages, Call logs, Wi-Fi hotspot settings

On DUT device:
- Must be connected into a Wi-Fi or mobile network
- Must be in Setup Wizard screen

On SUP device:
- SUP device with SIM Card to interact with DUT device

Both devices (Source and DUT) must be connected by a cable that is supported according to the device's HW USB (USB-C to USB-C cable or OTG cable)
TC_Steps:
0. On DUT, advance on Setup Wizard until the Copy apps & data screen and plug the USB cable on both devices (Source and DUT)

1. On source device, tap on "Copy" button

2. On DUT device Checklist screen, select which contents will be copied, then press "Copy" button

3. During the data transfer, from the SUP device, make and receive a call to source device

4. During the data transfer, from the SUP device, receive a notification (SMS, MMS or email) on source device

5. During the data transfer, from the SUP device, send photos or videos via Bluetooth to source device

6. During the data transfer, unplug the cable

7. Plug the cable and follow the instructions for continuing the data transfer exactly where it was interrupted

8. Complete Setup Wizard and check if all data has been tranferred to DUT device
TC_Expected_Results:
0. On both devices a screen is displayed when recognizing the devices

1. The screen lock is confirmed and the copy process is initiated confirming the account too

2. The copy process starts

3. On DUT device, data transfer must not be interrupted

4. On DUT device, data transfer must not be interrupted

5. On DUT device, data transfer must not be interrupted

6. Both devices (source and DUT) must pause the data transfer and inform the user to plug the cable

7. Both devices will continue the data transfer 

8. The DUT device must display "Copying's done" screen with all types of files copied from source device (Check the Test Step Coments to confirm that all data transfered successfully)
TC_Labels: Android_S Android_T Core_reg common_validation_reg transfer_over_USB_cable

TC_Setup:
0. It's necessary 2 devices: 1 Source and 1 DUT
- DUT: this device will be treated as the Target device (the one that will RECEIVE the data transfer)
- Source: this device will be treated as the Source device (the one that will SEND the data transfer). In case DUT is at the same Android OS than Source, it is preferred they should be the same product

On Source device:
- Must have a SIM Card inserted
- Must have a SD Card inserted with the same data mass located on the following drive: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/15eUkFpvGWj0EfthA3OKXB7Ppl6fGIo4b => DataMass from SD Ca
rd
- Must have the same data mass located on the following drive: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/15eUkFpvGWj0EfthA3OKXB7Ppl6fGIo4b => DataMass-5GB
- Must have Google Calendar, iMessages, SMS, MMS text and associated media, Third-party apps for iOS, Local contacts, SIM contacts, WhatsApp messages, Call logs, Wi-Fi hotspot settings

On DUT device:
- Must be connected into a Wi-Fi or mobile network
- Must be in Setup Wizard screen

Both devices (Source and DUT) must be connected by a cable that is supported according to the device's HW USB (USB-C to USB-C cable or OTG cable)
TC_Steps:
0. On DUT device, advance on Setup Wizard until the Copy apps & data screen and plug the USB cable on both devices

1. On source device, tap on "Copy" button 

2. On DUT device, on Checklist screen, select which contents will be copied, then press "Copy" button

3. During the data transfer, play music on source device

4. During the data transfer, watch video on source device

5. During the data transfer, take photos or recorde videos on source device

6. During the data transfer, listen to music by using Bluetooth headset on source device

7. During the data transfer, set an alarm to ring before the transfer completes on source device

8. Complete Setup Wizard and check if all data has been tranferred to DUT device
TC_Expected_Results:

TC_Setup:
0. It's necessary 2 devices: 1 Source and 1 DUT
- DUT: this device will be treated as the Target device (the one that will RECEIVE the data transfer)
- Source: this device will be treated as the Source device (the one that will SEND the data transfer)

On Source device: (Android S or higher)
- Must have a SIM Card inserted
- Must have the same data mass located on the following drive: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/15eUkFpvGWj0EfthA3OKXB7Ppl6fGIo4b => DataMass-552MB
- Must be connected into a Wi-Fi or mobile network

On DUT device:
- Must be connected into a Wi-Fi or mobile network
- Must be in Setup Wizard screen

Both devices (Source and DUT) must be connected by a cable that is supported according to the device's HW USB (USB-C to USB-C cable or OTG cable)
TC_Steps:
0. On DUT device, at choosing the system language screen, tap on Vision settings, then, toggle on Use TalkBack

1. On DUT device, advance on Setup Wizard until the Copy apps & data screen and plug the USB cable on both phones

2. On support device tap on "Copy" button 

3. On DUT device, SKIP the Google Account signin

4. On DUT device, select which contents will be copied, then press "Copy" button

5. Complete Setup Wizard and check if all data has been tranferred to DUT device
TC_Expected_Results:
0. TalkBack must give the user the spoken feedback of all text displayed on the Setup Wizard screen

1. The screen lock is confirmed

2. The copy process starts on both devices

3. On DUT device, checklist screen will be displayed

4. On DUT device, the copy process starts

5. Check the Test Step Coments to confirm that all data transfered successfully
TC_Labels: Android_S Android_T Core_reg common_validation_reg transfer_over_USB_cable

TC_Setup:
0. It's necessary 2 devices: 1 Source and 1 DUT
- DUT: this device will be treated as the Target device (the one that will RECEIVE the data transfer)
- Source: this device will be treated as the Source device (the one that will SEND the data transfer)

On Source device: iPhone - Model Name: iPhone 8 or higher
- Must have the same data mass located on the following drive: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/15eUkFpvGWj0EfthA3OKXB7Ppl6fGIo4b => DataMass-552MB
- Must have SMS, Google Calendar, iMessages, SMS, MMS text and associated media, Third-party apps for iOS, Local contacts,SIM contacts, WhatsApp messages, Call logs, Wi-Fi hotspot settings


On DUT device: (Android T)
- Must be a Motorola Device not secure
- Must be connected into a Wi-Fi or mobile network
- Must be in Setup Wizard screen

Both devices (Source and DUT) must be connected by a cable that is supported according to the device's HW USB (USB-C to USB-C cable or OTG cable)
TC_Steps:
0. On DUT device, advance on Setup Wizard until the Connect both devices using the cable" screen and plug the USB cable on both phones

1. Make the source device accessible by confirming the trust connection between devices

2. On DUT device, in Checklist screen, select which contents will be copied, then press "Copy" button

3. On DUT device, after configuring Google services, data transfer will be initialized

4. Complete Setup Wizard and check if all data has been tranferred to target device
TC_Expected_Results:
0. A screen is displayed when recognizing the device

1. On source device, the lock screen is confirmed and Google account is required on target device

2. On DUT device, the setup of Google services must be required

3. On DUT device, the "Copying your data..." screen must be displayed through a progress bar

4. Once the transfer is complete, compare the files according to the source device files
TC_Labels: Android_S Android_T Core_Reg common_validation_reg transfer_over_USB_cable

TC_Steps:
0. Prerequisites: To ensure the SMS will not be sent as MMS, 
- do NOT insert Subject line to the SMS
- for SpyderU (EMARA) ST6 or later, do not modify the Messaging settings > 16 bit SMS encoding method and use whatever is the device default)

Test steps:
1. Set the device to es_US (or any other locale, including en_US, but preferably non-en_US in order to utilize the setup for localization validations) > open the Messaging application.
2. Compose a New text message and use non-ASCII characters ( "Start ~          l, FR:, IT: DE:, ES: , PT:, CS: , PL: , GR:, RS: KO:-_ZH:  _JP: , ,,BiDi:   ,end."). 
* Do not add Subject line, else the msg will become MMS 
3. Address/send it to self (the account of the test device) or to another accessible test device under the same carrier to avoid cross-carrier dependency. 
4. At the recipient' device, open the delivered Text message.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 1. Verify a SMS message containing non-ASCII characters is sent out from the device.  
2. Verify at the recipient' side the message is displayed without data corruption and appears in readable format (the text sent matches the text received).  

(Note: Due to a carrier requirement, some LatAm and EMEA carriers are converting all non-ASCII characters to utf-7 and as a result such characters from the original message will appear omitted or will be converted to plain ASCII in the received message. In ST6 the Messaging app has setting for 16bit and 7bit encoding (default) for products outside of US, SpyderUMTS)
Orig.TC#: 
ECG_Andr.App 3.l10n_i18n:016-171
ECG_Andr.App 3.l10n_i18n:016-233
TC_Labels: AOSP_Message Android_O_updated BB8 common_validation_reg non_network_dependent

d. The launcher and home screen icons for your app are no longer greyed out.

0. Exchange accounts that contains display names utilizing non-ASCII characters:

TC_Steps:
0. 1. Setup a Google Mail or a corporate Active Sync account on the device with a MS Exchange server that contains display names utilizing non-ASCII characters, (e.g. Franois vian, la, , , , etc.) in the global corporate directory list. 

2. At the device tap on the Corporate Sync email icon > open a new corporate sync email compose screen > place the cursor in the "To:" field, and start to type at least three non-ASCII characters, which match the display name of a contact from the global corporate directory, but the same name is "not" in the Contacts address book on the device (e.g. .g. since one of the test accounts is l, long press and hold on "C" from the device keyboard to enter "", then a, l, , , , , , etc.).

3. Repeat the same steps for the "cc:" and "bcc:" fields.                 

4. Send the email and login at the Inbox of the recipients (it may be easier to have the email recipient' account configured at the test phone too)
TC_Expected_Results:

2. Verify the sent email message containing non-ASCII characters is sent fine and when delivered, the non-ASCII characters are rendered properly.

Turn off auto-rotation: adb shell content insert --uri content://settings/system --bind name:s:accelerometer_rotation --bind value:i:0
{0 at the end turns off, 1 turns on}

Then rotation command: adb shell content insert --uri content://settings/system --bind name:s:user_rotation --bind value:i:1
{0 at end means portrait normal position, 1 landscape to right, 2 upside-down, 3 landscape to left}

Doze Mode: 
Turn On: If a user leaves a device unplugged and stationary for a period of time (about 5~10 min), with the screen off, the device enters Doze mode. 

Turn Off: As soon as the user wakes the device by moving it, turning on the screen, or connecting a charger, the system exits Doze and all apps return to normal activity.

You can also use the commands:

Force the system into idle mode by running the following command:
  adb shell dumpsys deviceidle force-idle

When ready, exit idle mode by running the following command:
  adb shell dumpsys deviceidle unforce

- Please install the ConnectivityTest.apk to help get more info about connectivity.
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0BzRaoxTlh6dnendQVi0yUldadDA

How to install
$ adb root
$ adb remount
$ adb shell mkdir /system/app/ConnectivityTest

$ adb push ConnectivityTest.apk /system/app/ConnectivityTest/
$ adb reboot

Note: If the remount fails and the app still crashes after running the commands above, the tester should run the following before installing the app:

adb reboot bootloader
fastboot oem ssm_test 3 
fastboot oem ssm_test 4 
fastboot reboot

TC_Steps:
0. 1. Check all applications UI before font size change.

2. Check all applications UI after font size change by Settings.

3. Power cycle phone, then check all applications UI.

4. Check all font size by repeating step 1 to 3.
5. Repeating step 1 to 3 in landscape
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 2. All applications, including Settings, should use the new font size.
Note, The 3rd party app should also use the new font size, if it is using correct Android UI logic.


3. After power cycle, phone saved the font size correctly, and all applications use setup font size correctly.

4. Refer result of step 1 to 3.
5. Refer result of step 1 to 3.



Important Note:

N1. When textSize is set to "large" or "huge", there will be screen (text area) overflows on a large number of screens which we are not allowed to fix due to CTS restrictions.
So, don''''t submit the CR about text overflows, unless the text overflows in the "Normal" setting. 


N2. The "Text size" (it actually sets "text scale")  setting applied only to text fields whose textSize is specified in sp; it does not apply to fields whose size is specified in dp, dip, or px. Therefore, some text fields will not change size when the setting is changed.
sp (scaled pixels based on preferred font size)
px (pixels)
dp/dip (density-independent pixels)
See more here, http://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/TextView.html#attr_android:textSize

N3. Typical WAD CRs
IKHSS7-20697
IKHSS7-11482
IKHSS7-38336
IKHSS7-33920
IKHSS7-23886
IKHSS7-13889

TC_Setup: 0. Moto Alexa is signed-in with an Amazon account. Voice Activation is enabled and User has enrolled the voice in Moto Alexa.
TC_Steps:
0. While Alexa voice service is responding to User queries, check the interruptions caused by 

 (a) incoming Voice call, VoLTE call, Voicemail, Video call, VoWiFi call

 (b) incoming SMS, MMS messages, Email, Google Chat chat message, Emergency Alerts

 (c) incoming Google Duo call, Skype call

 (d) Low battery warning

 (e) data connectivity change between WiFi and LTE / 5G network data

 (f) Airplane mode ON

 (g) switching OFF the Cellular data

 (h) no network coverage and data connectivity
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 
(a) AVS voice responses is interrupted by the incoming Voice call, VoLTE call, Voicemail, Video call, VoWiFi call

(b) AVS is not interrupted by the incoming SMS/ MMS/Google Chat messages, Email and Emergency Alerts which can be accesseed from Notifications.

(c) AVS is interrupted by the Google Duo and Skype calls.

(d) Low battery warning shows up to the User and does not interrupt the AVS.

(e) AVS services are available in WiFi coverage and continues to be available in LTE and 5G network data coverage.

(f), (g), (h) AVS services are NOT available in Airplane mode ON, Cellular Data OFF, in no network coverage and no Data connectivity situations.

TC_Setup:
0. Moto Alexa is signed-in with an Amazon account.

Voice Activation is enabled and User has enrolled the voice in Moto Alexa.

In Settings -> Sound -> Do not disturb -> Automatic rules, add a Time rule to turn on DND during specific times and name it as 'My new rule'

(This Moto Alexa test case is applicable for Phone-only and Phone with Alexa MOD attached)
TC_Steps:
0. Voice Trigger -
Check the Alexa wake-word trigger during DND mode -  'Alarms only', 'Priority', 'Total Silence' 


1. App Touch Trigger - 
Try launching Alexa app from App tray when device is in DND mode and attempt AVS service by clicking the 'Barge-in' icon in Alexa app.


2. Alexa Notification Trigger - 
Try AVS trigger using Alexa notification icon from Notification bar during DND mode.


3. When the device is NOT in DND mode and while active Alexa voice response for User queries, put the device in DND mode using quick settings panel. 


4. Enable the option 'Block when screen is on' in DND settings to block the visual disturbances of notifications silenced by DND. Trigger Alexa by Barge-in Touch and Voice trigger.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. AVS is triggered by the Alexa wake-word during DND mode when DND is set to 'Alarms only' or when set to 'Total silence'
Note - With DND set to 'Total silence' option, only visual Alexa card response is possible and the audio response is not heard.


1. AVS is launched from App tray during DND mode, when DND is set to 'Priority' / 'Alarms only' / 'Total silence' and responds to User queries upon clicking on the 'Barge-in' icon.

Note - With DND set to 'Total silence' option, only visual Alexa card response is possible and the audio response is not heard.

2. When DND is set to 'Priority' / 'Alarms only' / 'Total silence', Alexa responds to User queries upon clicking on the Alexa notification.

Note - With DND set to 'Total silence' option, the audio response is not heard.
3. The Audio response of Alexa is continues even after device enters in DND mode ('Alarms only', 'Priority')

Audio response is stopped immediately when device enters in DND mode (''Total Silence' )


4. In DND mode with the option 'Block when screen is on' enabled, Alexa notification icon does not appear when AVS is triggered by Barge-in icon Touch and Voice trigger.
TC_Labels: Exp_Reg MOD_Reg analyzed common_validation_reg mod_alexa non_network_dependent

0. Go Dual SIM Wizard via:
- Dual SIM Wizard notification on Notification bar
OR 
- Via Settings > Network & Internet > SIM cards

1. Select Smart SIM and pass trought the DS Wizard Setup (Refer to Test Case MCA-972763 in case of doubts)

2. Go to Settings > Network & Internet > SIM Cards and tap on Dual SIM usage profile

3. Select Personal and Work

4. Tap on "Change Profile" on confirmation Pop-up

5. Pass trought the DS Wizard Setup until completion of Personal and Work profille(Refer to Test Case MCA-975411 or MCA-975440 in case of doubts)

6. Go to Settings > Network & Internet > SIM Cards and tap on Dual SIM usage profile

7. Select Manual

8. Tap on "Change Profile" on confirmation Pop-up

9. Pass trought the DS Wizard Setup until completion of Manual usage profile (Refer to Test case MCA-972762 and MCA-975392 in case of doubts)
TC_Expected_Results:
1. Smart SIM usage profile can be set without any ANR,Tombstone or any other issue

5. Personal and Work usage profile can be set without any ANR,Tombsone or any other issue
Also verify that no info is mixed between both profiles

9. Manual usage profile can be set without any ANR,Tombsone or any other issue
Also verify that no info is mixed between both profiles
TC_Labels: Android_O BB8 CN_Partial_Support DSDS_Reg Latam_Reg common_validation_reg execute_davros execute_davros_brazil execute_davros_china execute_davros_india execute_local_network product_validation_reg spotcheck_ds

TC_Setup:
0. Two SIM Cards on device

1. Have one Alarm previously set to be triggered during Dual SIM Usage profile setup
2. Only applicable for Android O devices
TC_Steps:
1. Go to Settings > Network & Internet > SIM Cards and select the "Smart SIM" option

2. Pass through Smart SIM setup until Alarm be triggered

3. Dismiss Alarm

4. Complete Dual SIM usage profile setup
TC_Expected_Results:
1. Verify that Smart SIM selection is displayed

2. Dual SIM usage profile setup is interrupted by Alam with no abnormal behavior

3. Alarm can be dismissed succesfully and DUT returns to the point interrupted by Step 3

4. Verify that:
- The options Easy prefix (if available for the region), Data, SMS, Calls are correctly configured with the previously set Usage profile values and the option "Usage profile" is indicating the correctly persona
- Verify if changes made on SIM name, Color and Phone ringtone are retained after setup completion
TC_Labels: Android_O BB8 CN_Partial_Support Latam_Reg common_validation_reg execute_local_network network_dependent network_leverage no_efficiency

TC_Setup:
0. Two SIM Cards on device

1. Have one Support device with Calling capabilty available
2. Only applicable for Android O devices
TC_Steps:
1. Go to Settings > Network & Internet > SIM Cards and Select the "Manual" option

2. Pass through Manual profile setup and receive a MT call

3. Answer the call, stay connected for a couple of minutes and then hang up
TC_Expected_Results:
1. Verify that SIM Preferences screen is displayed

2. Call notification is displayed on top of the screen

3. Call can be hang up succesfully and DUT returns to the point interrupted by Step 3

4. Verify that:
- The options Easy prefix (if available for the region), Data, SMS, Calls are correctly configured with the previously set Usage profile values and the option "Usage profile" is indicating the correctly persona
- Verify if changes made on SIM name, Color and Phone ringtone are retained after setup completion

TC_Setup:
0. A Provisioning client to be configured. A Provisioning server connected to the Internet. The Client doesn't have existing APN profile with the name  of applications  being provisioned . Phone registered to the GSM or UMTS network. Phone is in full_ui mode.

Priority given to customer client provisioning server if available. Otherwise use the Motorola NowSMS server.  Carrier requirements refers primarily to Verizon, Vodafone, and T-Mobile Europe for now.

XML provisioning document with right settings should be used for this test (test_002.xml). The User Pin should be provided.

You can download XML at: https://drive.google.com/a/motorola.com/folderview?id=0B-A2luimi8RUfjVpQjNsNGxqcmUzd2VYNjY3cU5ZWW5BbjduNHpWaWhYcEVlckVmQVdVelk&usp=sharing

1. For M release, please refer XML test_002_modified_to_M.xml
TC_Steps:
0. From the Provisioning server, send the provisioning document to the phone.

1. Select notification. Accept the new APN Profiles when prompted on the phone, enter the authentication pin and add APN profiles.

2. Verify that one APN Profile is present on the phone.
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Verify that new notification in the Notification Bar is displayed.

1. Verify that the phone prompts for the end user to accept or ignore the new APN profiles.

2. Verify that the APN Profile (the last one in the XML provisioning file) is created correctly on the phone and all settings match the provisioning document.
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable Brazil_Support CN_BR_Support EDA_updated Latam_Reg OMACP common_validation_reg difficulty_level_medium network_dependent

TC_Setup:
0. 1. Have a support Device in BP tools mode.
2. Have a SMS_Cin (SMS_Cin.rar on Attachments) tool or any tool capable of sending XML Setting Document (https://sites.google.com/a/motorola.com/platform-wiki/test-execution/manual/regression/sending-provisioning-messages-using-sms_cin-tool)
3. Download the XML file document (test_013_S.xml) here
TC_Steps:
0. 1. From the Provisioning server (have PIN provided your service provider), send the provisioning document to the phone.
2. Observe if message is sent by the server.
3. Tap install
4. Enter the invalid PIN three times..
TC_Expected_Results:
0. 4. The APN is not be processed.
Verify that no new notification in the Notification Bar is displayed.

TC_Setup:
0. A Provisioning client to be configured. A Provisioning server connected to the Internet. The Client doesn't have existing APN profile with the name  of application being provisioned . Phone registered to the GSM or UMTS network. Phone is in full_ui mode.

XML provisioning document with right settings should be used for this test test_014_S.xml). The User Pin should be provided.

Priority given to customer client provisioning server if available. Otherwise use the Motorola NowSMS server.  Carrier requirements refers primarily to Verizon, Vodafone, and T-Mobile Europe for now.

You can download XML at: https://drive.google.com/a/motorola.com/folderview?id=0B-A2luimi8RUfjVpQjNsNGxqcmUzd2VYNjY3cU5ZWW5BbjduNHpWaWhYcEVlckVmQVdVelk&usp=sharing
TC_Steps:
0. From the Provisioning server, send the provisioning document to the phone.	
1. Select notification and tap on Install

2. The user pin entry screen should be prompted.	

3. On PIN Screen, tap on Cancel and then Delete
4. From the Provisioning server, send another provisioning document to the phone.	
5. Select notification. Don''t accept the new APN Profile when prompted on the phone. Choose option Postpone.
6. From the Provisioning server, send another provisioning document to the phone.	
7. Select notification. Don't accept the new APN Profile when prompted on the phone. Choose option Delete.
8. The confirmation screen should be prompted.
9. Tap on Yes option
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Verify that new notification in the Notification Bar is displayed.

1. When select the notification the screen will show 3 options: "Postpone", "Delete" and "Install". When click install it will display the screen that asks for PIN.
2. Verify that the user pin entry screen will be prompted.
3. After confirmation message will be deleted.

4. Verify that new notification in the Notification Bar is displayed.
5. The message should be postponed. And notification in the Notification Bar is displayed.
6. Verify that new notification in the Notification Bar is displayed.
7. Verify that the phone prompts for the end user to accept or ignore the new APN profile.
8. Verify if Yes and Not options are available
9. After confirmation message will be deleted.
TC_Labels: BB8_not_applicable Brazil_Support CN_BR_Support Latam_Reg OMACP common_validation_reg difficulty_level_high network_dependent

TC_Steps:
0. Compose an MMS and attach a new picture taken with the phones camera. While composing the MMS, receive a SMS from support device. Finish composing the MMS and send it.
1. Set an alarm alert for a time 1 minute from now and then open the Messaging application. Compose an MMS and attach an existing image from the Gallery. Compose the message until the alarm alerts. Dismiss the alarm, finish composing the message then send it to a support device.
2. Compose a MMS with text and a VCard attached. While the message is being composed, connect and disconnect a plugged in wall charger. Send MMS to a support device, continue to  connect and disconnect a plugged in wall charger while sending.

3. Compose an MMS with text and an attached video from the Gallery. While composing the MMS, receive a call from support device. Accept the call and then end the call.

4. Send the MMS to a support device and while it is sending receive a call from support device. Reject the incoming call.
5. Compose an MMS with text and an new slide which insert a new/existing image, a new/existing audio and a new/existing video, while composing slide, receive incoming call then send the MMS
TC_Expected_Results:
0. Verify that user will be notified that a new SMS arrived but it will not interrupt the message composition. The message can be succesfully sent and received on support device.
1. Verify that the alarm will alert while the user is composing a message and that the user can complete composing the message after the alert has been dismissed. The message should be correctly received on support device.
2. Verify that the user is able to compose an MMS and send a MMS with text and attached Vcard while a plugged in wall charger is connected and disconnected. The phone should notify the user when the charger is connected and disconnected (only if battery charge increase) and the MMS should be received correctly on the support device.
3. Verify the user is alerted to an incoming call and is able to accept it while composing a MMS. After the call has been ended the user should be able to complete composing the MMS.
4. Verify that the test phone completes sending an MMS with text and attached video while receiving an incoming call that is rejected. The MMS should be correctly received by support device.
5. Verify that user is able to compose an MMS with a slide attached, no errors occured when composing the slide, the MMS should be correctly receievd on the reference device.
TC_Labels: AOSP_Message BB8_not_applicable GMS_Message Plat_Reg common_execute_local_network common_refactored common_validation_reg difficulty_level_high product_validation_reg
